column1:
0,"

The California Milkweed Highway or CMH is a strategic network of nine self-sustaining Monarch Butterfly habitats and controlled milkweed farms that will run the length of California.  These habitats will be geared toward feeding and repopulating the Monarch Butterfly.  Our solution will not only DOUBLE the Monarch population in 3 years but will act as a sustainable, “pollinator backbone” to California food growers who supply 65% of America’s fruits and vegetables.

Funding this campaign will allow us to break ground this summer on our first habitat, the CMH Headquarters, where we will rapidly grow milkweed and develop our template for our next 8 habitats.

The disappearance of the Monarch Butterfly will have a negative “butterfly effect” on our food chain that will eventually affect every person in the U.S., let alone the world.  Please help us stop this extinction and support our California Milkweed Highway campaign to begin building.

To learn more about us and read our full story, please visit our website. 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Once the facility is up and operations have been established, we will be open to visitors during the time of year when Monarchs emerge. Imagine sitting on YOUR BENCH (perk)  in an open-air greenhouse watching the Monarchs dry their wings with your family and friends. Imagine the fresh air from the Carbon neutral environment and the slightly sweet smell of milkweed all around you as you walk down the foundational pathway where YOUR LEGACY BRICKS (perk) line the nectar meadow. Imagine the pride you might feel for how you fought for a better future. Imagine the delight of your children (the best perk) playing on your legacy foundation.

We are raising $800,000 to begin building the first habitat in The California Milkweed Highway. The funds will be allocated as below. This a fixed campaign, so no perks will be sent until the goal is met. If we exceed the goal, we have a great surprise for all our backers.

column1:
We think our perks are AWESOME, unique and very appropriate for this legacy building effort. Please check out the custom bricks that will line the paths of our first habitat. Or select one of our hot new California-style T-shirts – our amazing design is courtesy of the talented team at Mask Your Beliefs.  Other legacy items for you or your organization include a place in our HQ Time Capsule or a Customizable Bench that is sure to get a lot of use in its prestigious spot at our HQ Facility. Check out all of our cool perks and watch for more to come as our campaign spreads!

If we don’t reach our goal, IndieGoGo refunds everyone. No perks will be delivered. And a big “boo” for humanity.  Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm. 

We would like to especially thank our pre-launch partner teams at Aerospring and Mask Your Belief for their support and encouragement us to keep working toward making our vision a reality.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a real difference for our planet and for future generations to come.  Your impact will be evidenced in 3 years or less when the Monarch population is doubled in California.  So, if you want to be part of a solution that helps the planet for many human generations to come, this is an amazing way to secure your legacy.  The beauty of building The California Milkweed Highway is that it is a Win-Win-Win! 

1.  The Monarchs thrive
2.  Pollinators help food growers 
3.  Your food remains available and priced fairly. 

Every dollar you contribute will be spent on growing native milkweed and growing Monarchs. Your backing means the world to us and together we CAN save the Monarch Butterfly.

With 15+ years business management experience and advanced education, 150Left.com has the diverse experience, strong passion, and unique abilities that are needed to execute this mission.  We intend to focus all our abilities to make The California Milkweed Highway a reality.  We will be partnering with experts in science, agriculture and conservancy and utilizing the latest AgTech solutions to make this happen.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

When we saw the Monarch Butterfly population decline data, we were stunned and knew we had to do something that wasn’t being done.  We are putting our everything into this campaign. After the pandemic hit, both of us became unemployed. We used our pandemic relief money to start this venture and now we are ready to carry out our plans with conviction.

Honestly, being a farmer isn’t a glamorous prospect and leaving Silicon Valley careers seems foolish. The thing is though, we want to make a genuine impact with our efforts and ideas.  We know there are risks and challenges in building the CMH but we are prepared to overcome any hurdles to make this happen. 

The good news is that Milkweed is an untapped market and has lots of potential for very profitable, downstream products.  From biodegradable packaging materials to hypo -allergenic fillings and insulations, there is strong evidence that milkweed can become the next “unicorn” in the material science world.  This is what we want to bring to the world. Something unique, amazing, and transformative all the while saving a species from extinction.

Some of the initial risks / challenges we have identified:

column1: • Land: It is a big challenge to find affordable land that meets our habitat size and criteria - especially, along the Monarch migratory path and in California in general. Our site selection criteria will be key into intelligently selecting and utilizing our habitat locations.

• Funding:  Government programs and grants could take years to get funded and are not set up to assist funding innovative AgTech solutions.  We will need to continuously and creatively seek funding wherever possible until all 9 habitats are built.

• Water is always a challenge and California is a desert. Our habitats will benefit any area surrounding their locations in that our proprietary habitat design includes key features to make them as self-sustainable and drought-resistant as possible.  attirWater is expensive and we need to get it to the place it needs to be and keep it there.
• There may be competitive threats but for now they are opportunities as no one has ever done anything like this before.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help us get the California Milkweed Highway built! Contribute to our fund.  Share our campaign and website (https://150left.com) to help us build a positive, caring community.  Ask questions, join our forum, and generally be a good person.  You can make a direct impact.  You can help us save the Monarch Butterfly!

column3:
>Engineers, this is your great opportunity to have this e tool for engineering and prototyping electrical systems for your applications.

Go to the right and choose the temporary perk.

Only 3 units are available.

 

ERGBOX is production ready and delivery will begin in January!
column8: >The IoT Gateway is the brain of the kit, and it provides a powerful tool to interface between the internet of Humans and the Internet of Things. This module controls and monitors all other modules connected to the kit, as well as third-party devices through reliable industrial protocols such as CANbus and I2C, through a simple and transparent message format and are powered by popular Arduino® and Raspberry® technologies.

column1:
Smart Sensors Gateway (SSG)

The Smart Sensor Hub is a local interface for sensors connection. Up to 6 sensors slots (2x digital, 2x analog, 2x I2C) are available giving access to a world of expansion opportunities thanks to the compatible “Grove” add-ons produced by Seeed Studios. As of this launch, there are over 90 plug-and-play add-ons available online. But also other standard sensors available for more robust applications.
column2:
>2 sensor Included:
1x Digital Temperature, 1x RGB Led indicator

column1:
Smart Power Switch Unit (PSU)

The PSU is a Solid State power switching unit. It has 8 output ports, easy installation, and operation. This ports can switch DC loads, up to 10A each. 
Each output has its own Current measurement, allowing precise and fast feedback of the load's  behavior.

Smart Power Distribution Unit (PDU)

The PDU is a Solid State power distribution unit, equipped with ATS (Auto Transfer Switch) providing failsafe operation in redundant power supply applications. It has 8 output ports that provide up to 10A each, precise and fast measurement of current, software fuse to limit consumption, easy installation and operation.

Smart DCDC Stepdown (STD)

The Smart DCDC Stepdown is an adjustable voltage supply (5V - 24V) with plenty of power (up to 25A) to suit most applications within this voltage range. Voltage output can be adjusted on the fly, It delivers a clean output with high efficiency, high reliability, very low output ripple, low quiescent current.

Smart Current Sensor Unit (CSU)

The Smart Current Sensor is a current measurement device up to 50A, with low quiescent current and digital I2C controls.
It also features a bi-directional fast Mosfet Switch to isolate both active and passive loads connected to the output. This allows you to safely turn on and off energy delivered to loads by simple code lines.
column3:
>Top Cover

The kit body is built with anodized aluminum, providing a sturdy fit for modules, as well as good heat dissipation in demanding applications.
The top cover is equipped with Status LED's and LCD display for visual feedback and On/Off Power switch.
column5:
>Back Panel

On the back panel, you will find the power and external communication port, as well as the cooling fans and Smart Current Sensor.

Inside the Kit, there is a 300w 24V power supply to provide stable power to the kit applications using all modules.
column12:
>The development kits enable DC energy management through IoT. These kits are the same ones used by our engineering team and can be applied to a wide range of projects. (all devices developed and produced by TDL Energy)

Getting down to the nitty-gritty, please download here the ERGBOX's datasheet  and check all the details of what's under the hood
column13:
>

​​

ERGBOX is production ready and delivery will begin in January!

It will allow students and teacher of electronics to develop clean energy projects easily with minimal wiring and coding.

With it, they can engage in the Internet of Things and development and create manageable electric devices and systems.

We just need you to donate a tiny amount to make it possible.

  • 25$ Donation

To donate USD25.00 just go to the first perk on the right.

This money will be used to deliver ERGBOX to the schools listed below.

  • Donate ERGBOX to the school you love!

To donate an ERGBOX Full Edition to an institution of your choice  Click here

  • Donate any amount!

All donations received from the Back It button will be reverted to ERGBOX Full Edition Kits for the schools.

Spread the Word: With your help, we can give students the opportunity to participate in innovation and discoveries that will impact the future.
column15: >Professors, apply for ERGBOX for free here
column17: >Empower Technology Education with Industrial grade tools!
column18:
>Educate the Future!

ERGBOX is a robust and safe tool built for teaching and engineering labs with a roadmap of evolution that will keep you up to date with the latest and best technologies. ERGBOX is now available through this Crowdfunding operation, where you can donate it to your school of choice or buy it for yourself.

Our goal is to support education in technology. That's why we created this high-end industrial equipment, bringing students closer to real-life applications in a safe and creative environment.

We are raising funds to provide this kits for free to schools of electronics and electrical engineering and at the lowest cost as possible to engineers working in energy projects.
column19:
> 

Our goal is to support education in technology, with high-end industrial equipment, bringing students closer to real life applications, in a safe and creative environment.

Learn

People with the broadest range of skills in coding and electronics can learn easily. ERGBOX is flexible and can be used both by newbies and experts in coding and electronics. They can choose the configuration that fits their skill level and from there move forward in the direction they prefer. Step-by-step and “how to” tutorials will be available for every level of expertise while there will be ready-to-go Arduino sketches and Raspberry Pi routines for those interested in working with codes.

Teach

With ERGBOX, teachers can teach basic as well as advanced topics with the same low-cost hardware. Teachers can use the same platform for teaching different topics, from interaction design to firmware programming to robotics, and explore the possible synergies among topics. Teachers of different classes and fields can coordinate their action connecting different teams.
Students can create and share their own interactive stories and projects.

•  Hello my name is Bryce Bailey Gross. I have studied Mechanical Engineering at Michigan Technological University and believe the border situation may be helped by the outlined Solar Wall. My current career is in Motorcycle Safety in the great state of Texas!
• This campaign is designed to bring together people on both sides of the fence and fund the creation of a prototype Solar Wall... a green security initiative!

• Contributors will take part in the first step of a massive infrastructure endeavor, creating green energy, jobs, and border security along the California, Arizona, New Mexico and parts of the Texas border. And we can get Mexico to help fund it and go green too!

• The first step is the Structure design phase (see drawing). To obtain a viable blueprint this phase requires $30,000. After the design phase is complete, a prototype module will be constructed with the remaining $270,000
• If the construction phase is funded be ready for immense media recognition and coverage!
• If goals are not met refunds will be available
• If approved, this multi-billion dollar infrastructure endeavor will continue the transition to clean energy, facilitate job creation, and create a more secure border!

• People say that it won't work, people will damage the solar panels, climb over it or dig under it. Today's solar panels are very resilient, the wall will be very high (at 70 feet, it's 40 feet higher than current prototypes) and very thick (+500 feet and scalable)
• It'll be expensive, but a main goal of the Solar Wall is to have it pay for itself over 20 years through Power Purchase Agreements, many of which may be with Mexico.

• And then there is the challenge of an anti-green/pro-coal administration. Public pressure and bipartisan support should erode this stance and the Solar Wall will gain approval! And we can get Mexico to pay!
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
• Get the word out and let's make this viral!

Hello my name is Bryce Bailey Gross. I have studied Mechanical Engineering at Michigan Technological University and believe the border situation may be helped by the outlined Solar Wall. My current career is in Motorcycle Safety in the great state of Texas!
This campaign is designed to bring together people on both sides of the fence and fund the creation of a prototype Solar Wall... a green security initiative!

Contributors will take part in the first step of a massive infrastructure endeavor, creating green energy, jobs, and border security along the California, Arizona, New Mexico and parts of the Texas border. And we can get Mexico to help fund it and go green too!
What We Need & What You Get

The first step is the Structure design phase (see drawing). To obtain a viable blueprint this phase requires $30,000. After the design phase is complete, a prototype module will be constructed with the remaining $270,000
If the construction phase is funded be ready for immense media recognition and coverage!
If goals are not met refunds will be available
If approved, this multi-billion dollar infrastructure endeavor will continue the transition to clean energy, facilitate job creation, and create a more secure border!

People say that it won't work, people will damage the solar panels, climb over it or dig under it. Today's solar panels are very resilient, the wall will be very high (at 70 feet, it's 40 feet higher than current prototypes) and very thick (+500 feet and scalable)
It'll be expensive, but a main goal of the Solar Wall is to have it pay for itself over 20 years through Power Purchase Agreements, many of which may be with Mexico.

And then there is the challenge of an anti-green/pro-coal administration. Public pressure and bipartisan support should erode this stance and the Solar Wall will gain approval! And we can get Mexico to pay!
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Get the word out and let's make this viral!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
Finally! No more long  rides to the beach, or fighting over waves once you get there.

We are poised to make Charlotte, NC the next recipient of the new generation wave making technology. After decades of faulty wave pools that have been energy inefficient and lacking in power, we have found the solution in wave making technology set to change the surfing and water sports industry forever.
Our goal is to have funding secured, be fully permitted, and shovel ready by February of 2018- with an official open date in May 2019.
With 2 successful parks already operational and another 15 in the planning/ development stages, we are looking to make Charlotte the next recipient of this awesome water park.
• Sandy beach area to lay out and play
In order for us to make this happen we need you to respond, AND spread the word!
We are in the process of acquiring the 15-20 million necessary to build, but investors want to make sure there is enough interest in Charlotte for the park to be successful.

That's where you come in. With your show of support, we can put them at ease and secure the funding necessary  to start the project. Every donation counts, the more donations- the stronger the case to build in Charlotte- NOT Orlando (nothing against Orlando, but we want this in Charlotte). We will be throwing a party upon ground breaking, where all donors will be invited and acknowledged formally.

In the event the investors decide there is not enough support to build in Charlotte, those who have purchased season passes will have the option to either have their money refunded, or transfer it to the location we decide to build in. In either event, T-shirts for CITY SURF- Charlotte will begin being shipped in June 2017.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Please spread the word about CITY SURF- Charlotte.

We know there are enough people in the Carolinas that are either spending hours a year traveling to the beach to surf, or would start surfing if given the opportunity to be taught in a local facility. If you will not donate, please share with someone you know passionate about water sports.

column3: >Soapstand was created to take package-free soap liquid refill to the next level, making it accessible for all.
column5: >Soapstand is introducing an easy zero-waste alternative for bulk liquids. We have built the world's first automated liquid refill station for all your personal care and cleaning needs, readily available where you need it and when you need it the most. Together, we can bridge the gap between accessibility and sustainability.
column6: >       __________________________
column9: >We believe that reusable bottles can be a part of an amazing package-free experience. That's why for our initial launch, we carry a premium aluminum bottle that comes in silver and white.
column12:
>We are also constantly thinking of ways to design more beautiful bottles.
Here are some of our current designs.
column14: >
column15: >We have an amazing team here at Soapstand. Our team is passionate about sustainable technology, dedicated to protecting our environment, and has worked tirelessly to create a technology that reflects these values.
column16:
>Pictured above are from left to right: Kiru, Tenzin, Michelle, Jono, Andy and Abner. We’re missing Aliya from the photo, as she’s away relaxing on vacation!

1. How are we are using the donation?

It will be split into four parts: equipment purchases, production of different prototypes, testing, and preparation for commercialized manufacturing. We believe the minimum we need is $30,000
column17:
however, for a faster and more successful commercialization, we hope to have more support.

2. Do you sell the entire Soapstand unit?

Not at this moment. We are open to the conversation
column18:
however, unit operators must be businesses, municipalities, or organizations.  Soapstand currently owns all units and is developing a leasing plan.

3. What kind of retailers do you work with?

As a values-oriented company, we would like to partner with retailers who share our social and environmental mission. We are open to bringing Soapstand to businesses that are looking to significantly grow their green initiatives. 

4. When will Soapstand come to my city or neighborhood?

If we had our way... tomorrow! Please let us know which city or neighbourhood you live in and we will begin our efforts to move in nearby! Email us at hello@soapstand.com.

5. What is the positive and negative environmental impact of Soapstand?

Positive:

column1: • Waste reduction is our bread and butter. As so little plastic is properly recycled, Soapstands can help you prioritize your own waste reduction efforts.
• This also means less CO2 and methane emitted, with less natural resources used in manufacturing
• We have a soft spot for natural and eco-friendly products and will always default to a greener and healthier choice. This means fewer chemicals in our waters and in ourselves.
• There is no significant environmental impact other than from manufacturing the unit, which is more efficient than a regular vending machine.

• Though we manufacture in North America (Vancouver in particular), we may have to relocate that effort to a more cost-effective country in the future when we ramp up production. That will mean shipping. We are, however, dedicated to local whenever possible.

","Soapstand was created to take package-free soap liquid refill to the next level, making it accessible for all.Soapstand is introducing an easy zero-waste alternative for bulk liquids. We have built the world's first automated liquid refill station for all your personal care and cleaning needs, readily available where you need it and when you need it the most. Together, we can bridge the gap between accessibility and sustainability.       __________________________   We believe that reusable bottles can be a part of an amazing package-free experience. That's why for our initial launch, we carry a premium aluminum bottle that comes in silver and white.We are also constantly thinking of ways to design more beautiful bottles.Here are some of our current designs.We have an amazing team here at Soapstand. Water is something everything needs to survive.  The water crisis is something that everyone needs to be concerned about.  Rainfall amounts worldwide are falling leading to continued droughts and the inability to produce food.  However, while rainfall drops, there is still water vapour in the air.  Best of all, this water vapour is constantly being replenished.  It is replenished through the natural evaporation that takes place on the oceans, lakes, rivers, dams etc.  Ground moisture evaporates to provide atmospheric vapour.  Every living person (and animal) contributes to this vapour through the moisture that is exhaled every time you breathe out.

I live in one of those areas currently affected by drought.  The farmers in my area are not planting crops because they do not have enough water to grow them.  Farm animals are dying from dehydration or starvation simply because of the lack of water.  The water supply for towns in my area is running dry.  This is not something isolated to Australia, worldwide this is happening.

The effects of low rainfall are massive.  Without adequate rainfall farmers are reliant on bores or river systems to grow crops.  Drawing water from the river systems reduces the amount of flow available downstream.  This results in the river ecosystem being impacted negatively because without adequate flow the ecosystem of the river and the surrounding land starts to break down.  Water drawn from bores is not being replenished because of low rainfall and these will eventually run dry as well.

However while the rain does not fall, humidity levels in the air are still reasonable.  I have come up with a new way of drawing the humidity from the air and producing water at a quality that is suitable for human consumption.  My idea is also able to be increased in size to produce large amounts of water using only renewable energy sources.  This will have a massive impact worldwide.  Imagine being able to know you have water for your family that isn't contaminated.  That you have enough water for your animals.  That you can grow a crop or keep fruit trees alive even if the rain doesn't fall.

Eventually our models will range from small units the size of a water filter to provide a constant supply of fresh water for you or your pet (especially good if you have to go away and have someone else look after them - no worries about knocking the water bowl over) through to large units the size of shipping containers that can provide enough supply for multiple people in emergencies.  The technology can even be scaled up to full building size to supplement town or city water supplies.  It can also be scaled down to a backpack to provide water for a hike or camping trip.  These machines will also allow people in cities who are unable to access water any other way than buying bottled water or using tap water to drink water that does not contain fluoride or other additives that they don't want.  It will be fresh, clean and uncontaminated - just pure water.
By creating an artificial dewpoint you are able to condense the water vapour that exists in the air.  Think a cold drink on a hot day - how long before the glass or can is dripping with moisture?

The best way I can describe the whole process is by telling you the way I first thought of it.  I was in my car and backed out of where I was parked.  I looked back at where I was parked and in the time it took me to start the car and reverse out a pool of water had formed underneath it.  It was from the air conditioning.  So I started doing research on the systems and found that there are some outside Australia who produce these systems but they essentially use a form of air conditioner.  Looking at it I reworked the entire designs to be more energy efficient.

The design that I have come up with is adaptable so you can build bigger or smaller units with not much change to the systems.  For example with the prototype in a given environmental range I might produce 4 litres of water. By adding another condensation component I produce 8.

Even in the driest deserts there is still humidity in the air and as the air gets hotter its' ability to hold water also increases.  At 20 degrees Celsius the air can hold 18ml of water per cubic metre and at 30 degrees that increases to 30ml.  So using those figures at if you have 18ml of water in the air at 20 degrees it is 100% relative humidity and at 30 degrees it is 60% relative humidity.  If you have any questions please don't hesitate to get in contact and ask.
Please watch the below video to explain how condensation works:

To take this project through to production stage of these units, seed funding of $50 000 AUD is required.  This will take the project from development through to production of the first units.  I have designs and have a theoretical model.  A prototype model is being built right now.
$10 - I will send you a personal thank you email which will be the same for all donors.
$100 - will get your name printed in our perpetual list of donors which will be displayed on our website and in our head office (once we actually have an office).
$1000 - will get you a small machine that should generate up to 10 litres per day plus your name on our donor list.
$2 000 - will get you a medium unit that should generate up to 100 litres per day plus your name on our donor list.
$5 000 - will get you a large unit that should generate up to 500 litres per day plus your name on our donor list.
These are the initial perks and as funding progresses we will be able to provide more details.
If the full funding is not reached then we will utilise what we have and bootstrap the company until we have reached our goal.  This is what I have been doing up until this point.

This will transform the world as we know it.  No longer will people need to be within a certain distance of a lake or river or well to access water. No longer will people need to be worried about drinking contaminated water.  Having enough rain to water stock or grow crops will be a thing of the past.

This will also have a positive effect on the environment.  With farms being able to rely on water being generated by these machines they will no longer have to draw water from bores or rivers.  The underground aquifers will have a chance to refill.  Without the amount of water being drawn from the river systems, the river ecosystems and ecology of the surrounding areas will be able to recover.  The areas that are dying simply because of lack of river flow will be able to flourish once again, allowing the native wildlife to return to their former habitats.

My aim with the company is that once profits are being generated, those profits will go directly to funding machines to be provided to those people who need them for free.  This means communities worldwide could benefit from having access to clean water, the machine being a donation from the profits.
I am a stubborn and driven person and am determined to make this a reality, even if I have to fund all of it by myself.
Please share this if you cannot help yourself.  The world needs these machines.

Part of the solution to the climate crisis is to create a device that brings renewable energy production and storage to the individual in a way that has the lowest carbon footprint. I solely designed and manufactured a versatile portable electric storage and generator that I call a ℒightℂube. It is now built from plant-based plastics on 3D printers powered by 5 other ℒightℂubes. The ℒightℂube has a 1500W pure sine inverter with 2 outlets, a 2.4kWh battery, and a charge controller that handles up to 400W of solar. But this is still in the prototyping stage!
• The prototype price I am asking for is double the potential sale price. Each backer would in essence be giving us both a ℒightℂube, so I can expand the self-powered production capacity.
• Acquiring the requested number of backers for receiving prototype would allow me to produce enough ℒightℂubes to fulfill the prototype orders in a few weeks.

<li>Once this production system is created in a place with a lot of sun, I can focus my attention on the next step of including a made-in-America IoT communication device that broadcasts  WiFi and Bluetooth to host a web-based ℒightℂube status/control user interface. This can be configured to extend wifi networks, create a ℒightℂube mesh network, store data, host websites, perform math &amp

• I quit my job around e years ago, anticipating that in order to have the ability to open-source this project I would need to completely own my intellectual property. The open-source perk is around the salary I would have made had I not done this project. I have a patent pending with the ℒightℂube, but focusing on completing that would slow my progress. I will instead open source the project if someone buys the perk (as well as sending them the tooling for producing their own ℒightℂubes). If multiple open source perks occur, I will provide educational videos and livestreams of the development process. If all the open source perks are paid, all the prototype backers will receive production tooling to make a ℒightℂubes.

• If all the suppliers of each component (and their suppliers, etc) were to switch to renewable energy (preferably using the ℒightℂube), producing ℒightℂubes would be a carbon-negative process from just the carbon sequestered into the plant-based plastic.
• I will be replacing internal components with the most locally sourced components I can find, ideally by creating them myself.
• The ℒightℂube has a lower carbon footprint than any similar device because it is being produced by one person that already lives off of renewable energy from the ℒightℂube.
• A half size version is in the works, with pricing low enough to be affordable to almost everyone who can afford a cellphone.

• My initial inspiration was to create a large scale version of a plant cell. The ℒightℂube  is the mitochondria, the solar panels are the chloroplasts, and the 3D printers are the ribosomes. This project is the seed for an artificial tree.

• The long term goal for any renewable energy company is to transform the carbon economy. I have many other inventions to share and will bring them into existence as soon as I can start working on them.

• After more than 2 years without a job, I have reached the point financially where I can't progress unless all the prototypes are backed. I sold my house to raise money to acquire land with more sunlight.

I need to move to a place with more sunlight, and acquire or build a structure to manufacture in that has better climate conditions than an outdoor tent with mesh doors, and this poses a risk to the delivery time frame. Geopolitical developments can always pose risks to sourcing tooling and components, but in the long run this risk becomes eliminated as I integrate production vertically.

I only tested a couple of component suppliers, and would like to try to use as many as possible to find the best products. The prototype ℒightℂube you receive might not use the same components as the final production ℒightℂube.

This is a large workload for a single person, and there is a limit to the number of ℒightℂubes I can produce on my own in a single week. I think at least 10 a week will be easily feasible, and improvements to automation can increase that substantially.
I have very little waste in production and there is the potential to reclaim waste material to make it waste-free.

Patent Pending No. 2019/01482

What is the Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System?

Wet-WickTM is an innovative new sustainable technology for the self-regulated watering of most plants, including small trees, shrubs, vegetables etc. The system in its various adaptations dramatically reduces the inputs of water, fertilizer and labour thus increasing the efficiency and sustainability of the entire landscape or production system it is added to.

Wet-WickTM builds on a very basic but ingenious technique for delivering water and nutrients to plants, WICKING.  Certain materials, such as Nylon or Cotton are able to wick water and nutrients to the root-zone of a plant.    Many commercial hydroponic systems use this technology by having a reservoir containing water and nutrients, with a plant in a container suspended above or resting on top of the reservoir. The nutrient solution is then wicked upwards, into the root-zone of the plant.

The breakthrough achieved by the Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System, is the development of a complete plug and play (DIY) system that addresses three main points:

• Convenience – The design of the system allows anyone, at any skill level, to set up their own irrigation system, using wicking technology. As the system is completely self-regulating and can be setup in only 10 minutes, this represents the total time investment required. Once connected it will keep working so you don’t have to.

• Cost effective – The system has been developed to make use of parts that will not only last but are also extremely light weight. The weight of the complete system is about the same as that of a typical 20m garden hose. This makes the cost of transport as low as possible. As no electricity or pumps are used and there are hardly any moving parts, there is virtually no running cost. With savings of up to 70% in water, your savings will multiply year on year.

• Conservation – The combination of the comparably low volume of plastics used in manufacture, the carbon savings in transport, the savings in water and the limiting of fertilizer run-off, combine to make this the most environmentally advanced system of its kind, in the world.

How does it work?

The Patent pending Wet-WickTM satellite units act as slow release subsoil watering points. The Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System utilizes a dedicated container as a reservoir in order to create a self-regulating system that provides plants with “always on” water. This allows the plant to take up water as and when needed. The amount of water released by each wick is influenced by various factors such as the amount of moisture in the soil, type of soil, size of plant etc.

The container acts as:
• A reservoir, the quick couple connector(supplied) allows the bucket to be connected to your water mains, rain water tank or any other suitable supply via a standard garden hose.
• A pressure regulator, ensuring that the system has a constant low pressure, effectively only creating a link between the units and the reservoir.

How will you use it?

Some of the many ways in which you can use the system:

• If you have an existing irrigation system you can use the Wet-WickTM  Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System to act as a ""safety net"" for watering your plants. By adding this to your existing system you can go on holiday without any concern about power failures causing electronic timers to fail and your plants to suffer or die.
• Perfect for rain water collection tanks. Due to the low water usage and pressure required you can now use your roof to collect and feed your garden, NO PUMPS, NO ELECTRICITY needed.

• The Wet-WickTM  Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System is particularly well suited to raised beds. As raised beds tend to provide great drainage, they also tend to dry out very quickly. The Wet-WickTM  technology will help prevent this.

• If you live in an apartment and only have space for container grown plants, the Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System will allow you to set up a small patio garden in no time. Due to the fact that the containers are not “over watered” as is usually the case with containers, the unsightly mess caused by runoff is avoided.
• Why not collect all the waste water from your air conditioning unit? With the Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System you too can MAKE EVERY DROP COUNT!!

What does it include?

Each Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System includes:
• 25 complete Wet-WickTM  water dispensing units(pre assembled for your convenience)

The Impact

From an environmental point of view our system can really make a big impact. The world is starting to realize that water is our single most valuable commodity
column2:
there truly is nothing that we can do without water and our system MAKES EVERY DROP COUNT. We believe that by getting as many units in as many homes as possible, we can help make the most of the water available. By also reducing the threats posed by run-off caused by the inefficient use of fertilizers, the positive effects can be compounded. Education is the cornerstone of progress. By educating consumers and our youth about the ways in which we can simply use water more efficiently, whilst at the same time making it more convenient to grow plants and trees or any of the life giving flora that sustain us, we believe that we can truly change the world!!!

We believe that our product has to be more than something that you buy because you want to do the right thing, it's great if that is the case, but we want it to also make your life easier, save you time, and ultimately save you money!!! Convenience, Cost and Conservation.

The weight of the complete system is about the same as that of a typical 20m garden hose. This makes the cost of transport as low as possible. As no electricity or pumps are used and there are hardly any moving parts, there is virtually no running cost. With savings of up to 70% in water, your savings will multiply year on year.

Conservation – The combination of the comparably low volume of plastics used in manufacture, the carbon savings in transport, the savings in water and the limiting of fertilizer run-off, combine to make this the most environmentally advanced system of its kind, in the world.

How does it work?The Patent pending Wet-WickTM satellite units act as slow release subsoil watering points. The Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System utilizes a dedicated container as a reservoir in order to create a self-regulating system that provides plants with “always on” water. This allows the plant to take up water as and when needed. The amount of water released by each wick is influenced by various factors such as the amount of moisture in the soil, type of soil, size of plant etc.The container acts as:
A reservoir, the quick couple connector(supplied) allows the bucket to be connected to your water mains, rain water tank or any other suitable supply via a standard garden hose.
A pressure regulator, ensuring that the system has a constant low pressure, effectively only creating a link between the units and the reservoir.
How will you use it?Some of the many ways in which you can use the system:

If you have an existing irrigation system you can use the Wet-WickTM  Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System to act as a ""safety net"" for watering your plants. By adding this to your existing system you can go on holiday without any concern about power failures causing electronic timers to fail and your plants to suffer or die.
Perfect for rain water collection tanks. Due to the low water usage and pressure required you can now use your roof to collect and feed your garden, NO PUMPS, NO ELECTRICITY needed.

The Wet-WickTM  Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System is particularly well suited to raised beds. As raised beds tend to provide great drainage, they also tend to dry out very quickly. The Wet-WickTM  technology will help prevent this.

If you live in an apartment and only have space for container grown plants, the Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System will allow you to set up a small patio garden in no time. Due to the fact that the containers are not “over watered” as is usually the case with containers, the unsightly mess caused by runoff is avoided.
Why not collect all the waste water from your air conditioning unit? With the Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System you too can MAKE EVERY DROP COUNT!!
What does it include?Each Wet-WickTM Complete 3 in 1 Irrigation System includes:
25 complete Wet-WickTM  water dispensing units(pre assembled for your convenience)
The ImpactFrom an environmental point of view our system can really make a big impact. The world is starting to realize that water is our single most valuable commodity
column2: there truly is nothing that we can do without water and our system MAKES EVERY DROP COUNT. We believe that by getting as many units in as many homes as possible, we can help make the most of the water available. By also reducing the threats posed by run-off caused by the inefficient use of fertilizers, the positive effects can be compounded. Education is the cornerstone of progress. By educating consumers and our youth about the ways in which we can simply use water more efficiently, whilst at the same time making it more convenient to grow plants and trees or any of the life giving flora that sustain us, we believe that we can truly change the world!!!We believe that our product has to be more than something that you buy because you want to do the right thing, it's great if that is the case, but we want it to also make your life easier, save you time, and ultimately save you money!!! Convenience, Cost and Conservation.",3.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: My name is Xavier Rodriguez, CEO of Dax Multi-Media-Marketing.
I have successfully designed, manufactured, and tested, what I believe to be the future of mobile advertising or Mobiletising as I like to call it!

An example of what I have created can be found on my website:
daxmarketinghelp.com/Mobiletising

The device has come a long way since, for example. The unit is made of aluminum and completely waterproof. It comes with an internal lithium battery, solar power, alarm system, gps tracking and much more.. With the consumer in mind our unit is extremely user friendly connecting via smart device (Included in purchase) to showcase your ads. Also with a quick disconnect the unit is easily removable from the roof of your vehicle and can be stored away!

I have a manufacturer to create the housing already, I am simply looking for funds to push the project to the next level. I am seeking 5,000 dollars to finalize the prototype and get the units ready to be sold. Funds will go to parts, manufacturing, and marketing. For whatever reason the goal is not met, funds will still be put forth to getting the unit ready for mass production.

Mobiletising is the first of its kind! Help me showcase to the world the future of mobile digital advertising! With this device companies can now cut the billboard costs and showcase there ads when and how they want! No longer will you have to pay to have one ad shown in one location! With mobiletising you can showcase as many ads as you desire and showcase them anywhere a vehicle is permitted!

The unit has undergone several testing phases and each has been met with its own unique solution. With my creative background and help from a few engineers I have been able to overcome every obstacle to bring this project to life!
Help be a apart of the future as we know it! Please share this campaign and help me bring mobiletising to a vehicle near you!

My name is Karlis i'm 27 years old and want to create new product for my country  to save forests from cutting and earth from air pollution. I created my business and started to write projects, started with European union projects who help people with funding. They accepted my business plan and give small amount of funds to buy biomass rotary dryer but need all other devices to start productions, so i find crowd funding with hopes that someone will help me.

Project is based to ecological and earth friendly product creating. We will offer it to households and companies who use coal and other earth unfriendly product as firing fuel, to save trees and earth for next generations. Peat is ecological product and renewable. After firing it makes heating power very big such as best quality coal but leaves smallest amount of dusts and they are usable as fertilizer for garden.
If we reach 50000 dollar funding we will be able to buy biomass rotary dryer
At 100 000 dollar goal we will be able to buy pellet maker
At 120 000 dollar goal we will be able to get full set of production line
at 150 000 dollar goal we will be able to buy fork lifter to move production to warehouse (delivery trucks) or shower peat into dryer
All extra money will be spent to create new products from peat.
GRINDING SYSTEM FSJ1000 Hammer Blade Crusher
its just a little amount of devices what we need to start doing a good work for get earth cleaner.

In our country i will be only one who produce product like peat briquettes an pellets so no one wasn't heard about it and will need to make campaigns and advertisements to show all good things about peat and how it will help earth and how ecological they are.
I will be very happy if you share this project with family and friends and you will be mentioned in our homepage www.warmwood.lv as one who helped to reach our goals.

MoEnergy  is a combination of multi-functional DC/AC charger and a high power energy bank.  It is a powerful tool to meet ever increased mobile energy consumption challenges.
It is designed with rich wire or wireless outputs for regular or high power application, such as: mobiles, laptop, unmanned aerial vehicle, emergent medical devices, car tools, etc.
MoEnergy is a lightweight (less than 1kg) portable power station consists of hybrid power bank and DC&
column2: AC convertor，each part of the power kit can work independently or combine together to serve wide range of devices.

column1: Snap 2 parts together，the whole unit can serve as independent power station with DC5V，DC12V，AC120V（or AC240V）outputs. It can power multiple mobile devices by one or more of its 12 charging &
column2: powering ports in 120 watt limit.  No matter whether you’re enjoying a spring trip in the wild or working in a public corner,  you casual or urgent tasks will be secured by MoEnergy.

column1: With this multi-functional power bank of MoEnergy, you can charge up to 5 devices by one DC12V port , two DC5V USB ports or two type-C ports in 120W limit, wireless charge your QI compatible devices, use LED torch for lighting or SOS signaling, jump start your car. This sleek MoEnergy‘s powerbank can add so much convenience to your life!

No.3, Converter Mode
The converter of MoEnergy can power maximum 8 devices simultaneously in 120 watt limit. Its 6 USB ports, 1 car cigarette socket, 1 AC socket can give 5V, 12V, 120V (or 240V ) outputs for one or more devices in 120W limit.  The sharable converter can be a nice companion when traveling with family and friends.
MoEnergy’s Powerbank can be charged in 3 ways：

As the creator of MoEnergy, we believe that green energy is important. The DC 12V charging port of MoEnergy’s Powerbank can be charged not only by wall outlet but also by car’s cigarette lighter or portable solar chargers, thus, provide a hybrid energy solution to enhance people’s clean energy awareness.
MoEnergy’s Converter can be powered in 3 ways：
The Converter of MoEnergy can be powered by top energy bank through power pin connector or 12V Cigarette lighter port, as well as be powered by car’s cigarette lighter.
EnerTech dedicates to distributive energy products development. Our staffs have strong technical background in energy areas of brand company such as GE and Emerson
column2: we have numerous patents  in fields of renewable energies and materials. The company’s products include micro-embedded server backup battery, portable EV power bank, PV hybrid power battery system, they’re suitable for network servers, computer business terminals, emergency protection systems, EV, road relief, etc., as well as consumer electronics.

column1: This is our first Indiegogo campaign, in order to ensure MoEnergy to be a cool product, our team members are very experienced in electronic product design and manufacturing.  Many of our suppliers have donated their experiences to the product improvement too.

The product was designed with mature technologies of battery and charger, it was tested for varied devices in our laboratory and the result shows that it works fine on powering single and multiple devices. The cooperated factory has good assembling and quality control procedures. Due to continuous product improvement, the final products could be slightly different, but we’re confident at product quality and guarantee a good user experience.
If you like MoEnergy and hope it can help your friends, please share this project to them, more reviews and messages can help us perfecting the product.

As many of you know, on 2017, Puerto Rico got hit by a devastating hurricane called Maria. Soon after the hurricane I started to help families around the island using Diy Solar Generators that I put together using 18650 recycled batteries and equipment. Some of the generators were build on USA by members of the Diy community and other were made by me.

Thanks to God, we manage to help 49 families around the island... the goal was 100...!!!

We couldn't help more families because it took so long to put together a battery pack for a generator that by the time one device was done and ready to install, the family got their power restored.

After summer 2018 I started to tinker with the idea of a battery kit that allowed me to build diy battery packs fast and easy. That's when the Diy PCB Battery Kit was born.
column3:
showinfo=0"">

On this video I show you the humble beginnings of the battery kit.

The Diy Powerwall Battery kit was created to help the average person get a reliable source of energy storage fast and easy. When a pack like this was made in the past, the person had to solder the cells using heat from a soldering gun or using a spot welder which can be expensive. Now, they only have to place the cells on the board and make the proper connections, saving time and money while getting a sense of relieve and satisfaction.

Who will benefit from this kit?
- Diy Solar Energy community: We all want a reliable source of energy but we don't want to break the bank. A kit like this allows us to make Powerwalls fast and easy.

- Non-Profit Organizations: With a kit like this we can provide solar energy to remote areas while helping the planet sense we are using recycled lithium batteries that will end on a landfill if we don't act fast.

By having access to a battery kit they can deploy a camp anywhere and use the diy powerwall for lights and medical equipment without the need of gas generators.

They can also use the kit to donate solar generators around the world.

- Low income families: There is power in knowledge and the poor tend to pay the price because of this. Imagine a world where a low income family can have access to reliable energy storage that they've put together and with the savings they get from the utility bills, they can now use that money for a better education for their kids.

In this video I go over a full installation of a 1 Kwh Battery in under 1 hour:

column1: We are at full production mode with what I have available at hand.

The First Full Installation on a house.

What will I do with the funds.
I make and manufacture the powerwall kits at home and by myself. Thank God I have a large list of back orders but the amount of work is way too much for just one person to handle, specially without the proper tools and hardware.

That's why I need help...

For the first part of the project we are going to focus on these:
- Mass Manufacturing the kit: I already have a process figure out that allows me to make 100 - 200 kits per week. Its a very reliable process and with the right tools I'll be able to produce 10 times that, maybe more. 

- Job creation: I'll like to hire 1 or 2 people to start working on the project while I focus on making workshops on and offline. There's a second part of the project that needs my attention which is the Super Smart Battery Management System and I'll like to start working on it, ASAP.

- Working Space:  Right now I work at my house in a small 20'x8' space that I share with the laundry. I need a better working space to be able to expand the operation and also be able to hire employees and do workshops for the local community and the online crowd.

The SSBms or Super Smart Battery Management System is a most have tool on every Diy Powerwall that gets created. It prevents overcharging, over-discharging, overheating among other functionalities. 

I'll share the progress over my YouTube channel but in the meantime these are the functionalities that we want to have on the SSBms.

- Temperature reading
- Voltage and Current reading
- Access over mobile and web app
- Capable of working with Samsung Smart-things and Google Home.
- Power management of the house: Ex, Turn off a light remotely or shutoff the whole Powerwall from anywhere.
- Remote Service oriented
- Active Cell Balancing 

These are some of the core functionalities that we are looking to have on the SSBms but there is room to grow and that's why we will Open-Source the code to help out the community while also growing the software to its full potential. 

When the time comes we will also release the PCB design for the battery kit and the SSBms as an Open-Source license for personal use and non-profit organizations. This will allow us to help more families in Puerto Rico and other remote areas while also creating jobs and more resilient homes around the world.

I'll be forever grateful for the help that I got from the community when I was helping the families on Puerto Rico. 

49 homes is not a small number, but now, with your help, we can reach millions of families around the globe faster than ever while reducing the e-waste contamination that these cells produce when they end up in a land fill.

Thanks in advance for any help you can provide for this project.

God Bless you all.

Javier

Mist is the world's smartest sprinkler system. Install the Mist Sprinkler Controller and one or more Mist Sensors around your yard. Mist tracks soil moisture, sun intensity and temperature data in realtime and automatically optimizes irrigation for each part of your yard while using up to 50% less water.

column4: >Mist offers the world's-first ""drought mode"" setting that can be used when available water supplies are scarce. When selected, Mist applies the minimum amount needed to keep your drought-vulnerable plants alive. This is only possible thanks to Mist's advanced realtime sensors.

column1: Mist uses wireless moisture sensors to measure real-time water needs across the yard and then waters autonomously and on-demand keeping your lawn and garden healthy with no effort at all. This means you never have to bother with tweaking your sprinkler timer settings again.
Mist sensors track soil moisture, temperature and sun intensity data from any point of your property both in realtime and in aggregate.
column4: >Mist combines this knowledge about your yard with weather information and watering history and uses these insights to water the perfect amount every time.

column1: The Mist app provides you with full control over all the functions of your sprinkler system, including manually turning on/off watering zones, setting restricted days and hours to avoid watering, and setting advanced watering customizations.

column2: perk_id=3022209"" rel=""nofollow noopener"">
perk_id=3022169"" rel=""nofollow noopener"">
perk_id=3022200"" rel=""nofollow noopener"">
perk_id=3022216"" rel=""nofollow noopener"">
perk_id=3039418"" rel=""nofollow noopener"">

>We recommend a sensor for every distinct region of your yard. For example your front flowers could reference one sensor and your side lawn could use a different sensor. You can use one sensor for multiple zones if those zones have similar irrigation requirements, such as multiple zones in the front yard.

column1: How many sprinkler zones do you support?
Each mist controller supports up to 16 zones.
What’s the battery life for the sensors?

Mist sensors use rechargeable LiFePO4 batteries which support much higher discharge cycle counts than traditional Lithium-based batteries. We estimate even under harsh outdoor conditions, Mist sensor batteries will last around ten years.
Can I put more than one sensor in 1 sprinkler zone?
Yes you can. By default, Mist will reference the driest readings in order to maintain plant life.
How many sensors can connect to 1 controller?
You can connect up to 50 sensors to 1 Mist controller.
Yes you can. You can manage all your Mist controllers from the same Mist app. You just need to register these controllers to the same user account and the controllers will appear in your app.
Can I install the Mist controller outside?
The controller enclosure is not waterproof, but can be easily installed inside a weatherproof box. There are many compatible options in stores and online.
Drought mode is similar to completely shutting off your sprinklers, except Mist continues to monitor your plant moisture and very infrequently will apply just enough water to keep your plants alive.
Will Mist water more in drier, hotter climates?

Through it's unique ability to monitor soil moisture and track absorption while watering, Mist will always water more efficiently than traditional sprinkler timers as well as weather-based sprinkler controllers.
Can Mist be used for my hose-fed sprinklers?
Currently, Mist only manages sprinklers supplied by 24VAC solenoid valves and not hose-fed sprinklers.
Yes, so long as the irrigation line is supplied by 24VAC solenoid valves.
Will Mist work with my existing sprinkler system?
Mist is compatible with standard 24VAC-based in-ground sprinkler systems.
Does Mist support systems with a Master valve?
Yes, Mist includes a 24VAC output that can be used for a master valve or a pump start relay.
Does Mist support integration with rain sensors?
Mist sensors already provide rain sensing functionality which is why the Mist controller does not include connectors for additional rain sensors.
Does the Mist app work on my phone?

column2: Android and also have a web-based app accessible from any phone or computer.

column1: Initially, Mist is only shipping to the US and Canada.

","Mist is the world's smartest sprinkler system. Install the Mist Sprinkler Controller and one or more Mist Sensors around your yard. Mist tracks soil moisture, sun intensity and temperature data in realtime and automatically optimizes irrigation for each part of your yard while using up to 50% less water.

Mist offers the world's-first ""drought mode"" setting that can be used when available water supplies are scarce. When selected, Mist applies the minimum amount needed to keep your drought-vulnerable plants alive. This is only possible thanks to Mist's advanced realtime sensors.

Mist uses wireless moisture sensors to measure real-time water needs across the yard and then waters autonomously and on-demand keeping your lawn and garden healthy with no effort at all. This means you never have to bother with tweaking your sprinkler timer settings again.

Mist sensors track soil moisture, temperature and sun intensity data from any point of your property both in realtime and in aggregate. Mist combines this knowledge about your yard with weather information and watering history and uses these insights to water the perfect amount every time.

The Mist app provides you with full control over all the functions of your sprinkler system, including manually turning on/off watering zones, setting restricted days and hours to avoid watering, and setting advanced watering customizations.
How many sensors do I need?

We recommend a sensor for every distinct region of your yard. For example your front flowers could reference one sensor and your side lawn could use a different sensor. You can use one sensor for multiple zones if those zones have similar irrigation requirements, such as multiple zones in the front yard.
How many sprinkler zones do you support?
Each mist controller supports up to 16 zones.
What’s the battery life for the sensors?

Mist sensors use rechargeable LiFePO4 batteries which support much higher discharge cycle counts than traditional Lithium-based batteries. We estimate even under harsh outdoor conditions, Mist sensor batteries will last around ten years.
Can I put more than one sensor in 1 sprinkler zone?
Yes you can. By default, Mist will reference the driest readings in order to maintain plant life.
How many sensors can connect to 1 controller?
You can connect up to 50 sensors to 1 Mist controller.
Yes you can. You can manage all your Mist controllers from the same Mist app. You just need to register these controllers to the same user account and the controllers will appear in your app.
Can I install the Mist controller outside?
The controller enclosure is not waterproof, but can be easily installed inside a weatherproof box. There are many compatible options in stores and online.
Drought mode is similar to completely shutting off your sprinklers, except Mist continues to monitor your plant moisture and very infrequently will apply just enough water to keep your plants alive.
Will Mist water more in drier, hotter climates?

Through it's unique ability to monitor soil moisture and track absorption while watering, Mist will always water more efficiently than traditional sprinkler timers as well as weather-based sprinkler controllers.
Can Mist be used for my hose-fed sprinklers?
Currently, Mist only manages sprinklers supplied by 24VAC solenoid valves and not hose-fed sprinklers.
Does this work with drip irrigation?
Yes, so long as the irrigation line is supplied by 24VAC solenoid valves.
Will Mist work with my existing sprinkler system?
Mist is compatible with standard 24VAC-based in-ground sprinkler systems.
Does Mist support systems with a Master valve?
Yes, Mist includes a 24VAC output that can be used for a master valve or a pump start relay.
Does Mist support integration with rain sensors?
Mist sensors already provide rain sensing functionality which is why the Mist controller does not include connectors for additional rain sensors.
Does the Mist app work on my phone?
We support iPhone & Android and also have a web-based app accessible from any phone or computer.
Initially, Mist is only shipping to the US and Canada.",18.0,2,"1 Campaign

Hello! Our names are Kirill Novik and Cam Schubert, and we want to change the way you think about community living! We are directors of the nonprofit Aeroaquaponic, LLC. Our goal is to help build self-sufficient, ecologically sustainable communities around the globe. The current cycle of work-sleep-repeat not only fails to live up to human potential, but also contributes to the system of consumerism that harms our global ecosystem. By funding this campaign, you are not only helping to free people from the trappings of consumerism, but also to build a more sustainable future for our planet.  The short-term goal of this campaign is to build a prototype of such a community in the high plains of Colorado, U.S.A. 

We are setting a starting goal of $2,000 for our campaign, $1,500 of which will go directly towards community building, and $500 of which will go towards research and development. This research and development will be focused around soilless farming technologies and other means to make each community entirely self-sufficient. If we exceed our initial goal, all excess funds will be split along the same 3:1 ratio. For a contribution of $1 or more, you will receive access to extra content in our associated mobile game, Tycoon, and for $10 you will receive a signed electronic letter from a member of our team thanking you for your contribution. Higher value perks are forthcoming, depending on the level of financial support this campaign receives.


As we build this prototype community, we will be examining how best to live sustainably, even in the highly challenging environment of the Rocky Mountains. In our prototype community, there will be low rainfall, high wind, and cold winters, which allows us to better study the effects of difficult weather patterns on self-sufficiency. Tackling the problems inherent in climate change (particularly food, water, and shelter security) will require exceptional planning and preparation. But the time to begin the transition to sustainable living is now! The question is: will you join us?

 

We understand if you are unable to financially support us at this time, but please feel free to help by sharing this campaign with friends and family! Or come visit and/or share our website, http://aeroaquaponic.org/ .

We launched in one ago an association with the objective to provide innovative solutions for a sustainable world. During the COP22, the MIPAI launched ""Light Us"", a concrete initiative to raise awareness about the critically of fighting climate change. The MIPAI Institute members designed and manufactured a universal symbol, a photovoltaic and intelligent Torch that will be transmitted from one Conference of the Parties (COP) organizing nation to the other, similarly to the Olympic Flame. The Torch will travel from COP to COP to promote sustainable mobility. MIPAI ensured the first relay by bringing Light Us from Paris (COP21) to Marrakesh (COP22), on a series of seven TESLA cars, and presented the Light Us technology and objectives during the COP22.

Nous avons lancé il y a un an  l’association MIPAI dont le but est de proposer des solutions innovantes afin de  bâtir un monde plus respectueux de l’environnement. Le premier projet de l’association est de proposer un symbole à l’image de la flamme des jeux olympique, symbole qui sera transmis du pays organisateur de COP à un autre tel le  témoin  d’un monde durable. De cette idée est née «  LIGHT US », une torche dont le prototype a été transporté par l’équipe MIPAI de Paris (COP 21) à Marrakech ( COP 22) en Novembre 2016 lors de la 1ère édition du Light Us Relay qui fut couronnée de succès. Le projet « Light Us » fut nommé, par ailleurs, parmi les 4 innovations de la COP22. http://telquel.ma/2016/11/14/5-innovations-ecologiques-en-marge-cop22_1523500

We would like to take this opportunity to offer you to participate in a project history : we propose to produce a new symbol for sustainable development : the smart torch « Light Us ». Designed and produced by ordinary citizens of the world, she will educate humanity on the issue of global warming that threatens our future. The final version will be present in October 29 of 2017 in Marrakech.

Pour la 2ème édition, Nous aimerions saisir cette opportunité pour vous proposer de participer à notre projet historique: finaliser la production de ce nouveau symbole pour le développement durable, La Torche intelligente ""Light Us"" ! Elle est conçue et produite par d'ordinaires citoyens du monde et elle permettra de sensibiliser l'humanité sur la question de réchauffement climatique qui menace notre avenir. La version finale sera dévoilée le 29 octobre 2017 à Marrakech.

To present this torch, we will forward it from Paris to Marrakech in electric vehicle  during a single event : The Light Us Sustainable Relay. This will allow us to demonstrate that we can design to travel differently , in the interest of all.

Le prototype de Light Us fut acheminé de Paris à Marrakech en véhicules électriques dans le cadre de la 1ére édition du Relais Durable « Light us ». Nous avons pu démontré au monde que nous pouvons concevoir de voyager autrement, dans l'intérêt de tous.

Starting from COP22, the States that will receive the COP will transmit the torch as in an Olympic relay. If we succeed in making the issue of global warming a priority, then we will all have contributed to a future for our children.

À partir de la COP22, les Etats qui recevront la COP se transmettront la torche « Light Us » comme le relais Olympique. Si nous parvenons à rendre la question du réchauffement climatique une priorité, alors nous aurons tous contribués à offrir un avenir meilleur à nos enfants.
Light Us Sustainable Relay – Road To COP22

Last year we have submitted the project to the scientific committee of the COP22, which was evaluated positively our project. We thank the organizing committee of the COP22 and the Minister of Environment of Morocco , Mrs. Hakima El Haite , who testified his support on social media !

L’année dernière nous avons soumis le projet au Comité Scientifique de la COP22 qui a positivement évalué notre projet ! Nous remercions le Comité d'Organisation de la COP22 ainsi que la Ministre de l'Environnement du Maroc -  Madame Hakima El Haite - qui nous a témoigné son soutien  sur les réseaux sociaux !
Light Us Sustainable Relay – Road To COP23
This year too, the ""light us"" project has been labeled by the COP23 committee !!!
Cette année aussi, le projet « Light us » a été labélisé par le comité de la COP23 !!!
We also discuss with private partners, we hope to see many around this event.
Nous discutons également avec des partenaires privés. Nous espérons les voir nombreux nous soutenir pour cet événement.

Through the Light Us caravan and its Sustainable Relay, the MIPAI association wanted to demonstrate that we can now travel long distances in an electric vehicle, thus enticing the Mediterranean people to change their way of traveling to preserve the environment. For this year of 2017, 20 TESLA cars will migrate from Morocco to Germany, the hosting country of the COP23 that is under the chairmanship of Fiji with Light Us on board.

A travers la caravane Light Us et son Relais Durable, l’association MIPAI souhaitait démontrer que l’on peut désormais parcourir de longues distances en véhicules électriques, et ainsi inciter les méditerranéens à changer leur façon de voyager dans le but de préserver l’environnement. Pour cette année 2017, 20 TESLA vont migrer du Maroc jusqu’en Allemagne, pays hôte de la COP23 sous la présidence des Iles Fidji avec la torche Light Us à Bord.

The ""Light Us Sustanaible Relay"" is a green tourist rally to promote sustainable mobility and to bring the Light Us Torch from Marrakech (COP22) to Bonn (COP23)..
You will participate in a historic Rally with landscapes and unforgettable events !
The challenge is to make 3500 kms in 8 days by minimizing their consumption in an eco-driving logic. There is no notion of speed or regularity. Participants drive at their own pace in accordance with the traffic rules and safety requirements. This historic rally will cross 6 countries -Morocco / Spain / France / Switzerland / Belgium / Germany-

Le ""Light Us Sustanaible Relay"" est un rallye touristique vert pour la promotion de la mobilité durable permettant d'acheminer la Torche Light Us, de Marrakech (COP22) à Bonn (COP23) .
Vous participerez à un Rallye historique avec des paysages et des événements inoubliables !
Le challenge est d’effectuer 3500 km parcourus en 8 jours en minimisant leur consommation dans une logique d’éco conduite. Ce rallye ne challenge pas sur la vitesse! Les participants conduisent à leur rythme en respectant le Code de la route et les conditions de sécurité. Ils traverseront ainsi 6 Pays (Maroc / Espagne / France / Suisse / Belgique / Allemagne).

This rally does not challenge speed ! 100% electric TESLA vehicles are eligible to the Light Us Sustanaible Relay. Enrollments are open to individuals, companies, associations and communities. You are not the owner of TESLA? NO PROBLEM! MIPAI allows you to rent a short term TESLA to make the Road Trip Light Us Sustainable Relay !

Le Light Us Sustanaible Relay est destiné aux véhicules 100% électriques TESLA et les inscriptions sont ouvertes aux particuliers, entreprises, associations et collectivités.
Vous n'êtes pas propriétaire d'un véhicule électrique TESLA? AUCUN SOUCIS!
MIPAI vous propose de louer une TESLA afin de participer avec nous au Light Us Sustanaible Relay!

Introduction to us and how we started IndoorTree

My friend and I grew up in a small town in Hertfordshire called Welwyn Garden City. Having been raised surrounded by greenery we always took the air quality for granted. When we both went away to University in Bristol and Leicester we were struck by the stark contrast in air quality as is common in larger cities. I later came across several articles about the increasing level of pollution in the UK and was amazed to find that London reached its annual pollution target for 2017 in the first 5 days - I knew something needed to be done but at the time I wasn't sure what I could do.

I have always wanted to run my own business while simultaneously helping people, I just needed to work out what this could be. I came across an article about the incredible cleaning power of certain lichens and knew there must be a way to use them to help improve the air quality around the home. We started playing around with some simple concepts and eventually came up with the IndoorTree and started the process of creating our prototype.

 

How It Works

The IndoorTree uses a mix of mosses and lichens  to remove heavy metals, greenhouse gases, pollutants and toxins from the air. It then stores them in the plant and uses them as material to continue growing. ​

The types of moss we use are some of the earths strongest pollution cleaning resources and are many times more efficient then a tree. This makes us able to fit a powerful pollution cleaning device in a size that fits into your home and allows us to offer it at an affordable price for all.

 

What we need?

Achieving £10,000 in funding will enable us to produce the IndoorTree at a larger scale where we can benefit from economies of scale enabling us to produce the IndoorTree at an even more affordable price. 

We are able to produce the IndoorTree for the price advertised on our page guaranteeing that if you purchase one you will receive one. However if we reach our target we will be able to increase our gross profit margin allowing us to advertise or go down the third party and selected retail routes. This will get the IndoorTree into more people's homes, helping more families and removing more pollution from the air. 

 

The Impact

It's no secret that pollution is one of the biggest challenges this generation will face and it's not a battle that can be won by an individual. This is a matter of everyone doing what they can to minimise the negative effects of pollution on the environment and our families' health. 

Each contribution made will help us produce more IndoorTrees, help remove more pollution from the air and help an organisation trying to improve the world in a smart and commercially viable way. We hope this will be the first product of many.

 

Further Reading.

""mosses and lichens can also be used as filters to clean air pollution caused by toxic trace elements including the heavy metals mercury, cadmium and lead."" which are some of the most damageing results of air pollution.                                  https://theconversation.com/mosses-and-lichens-...

""mosses are a natural filter of air pollution""                       http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/magazine-40433931/...​

A mobile wall of moss, measuring around 3.5 meters is ""a plant-based air filter as powerful as 275 normal trees, in 99 per cent less space.."" https://www.independent.co.uk/Business/indyvent...

""Air pollution can make heart conditions worse... or even cause new problems."" https://www.bhf.org.uk/heart-health/living-with...

""Bradford air pollution causes 'one in four' child asthma cases"" https://www.telegraph.co.uk/science/2018/03/27/...

""For the third time, the UK government has been slammed by the courts for failing to produce an adequate plan to tackle the growing problem of air pollution,""  https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/fe...

""Air pollution is significantly weakening our hearts"" https://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/air-...

column2: support our new product concept come to life.

Since the exact number of backers is unknown to us, so the timing may fall out of schedule a little. But we did leave ourselves with extra time already, and we will try to get ahead of time for each step, so don't worry. :)
Shipping is another potential problem as well. Should the shipping take way too long than regular time, we will assume the package is lost and resend the reward. Promises :)

We will arrange the refund if it is strongly insisted. There is no point in keeping the money from backers if they don't have our back anymore. We will do our best to meet backers' anticipation as we should, and hope the worst won't happen.
