We are Tai Chow Sing and Siwar Amri , and we are based in Lyon, France.

Since 2011, we have been developing a new type of wind turbine to address the shortfalls which prevent more people from harnessing wind power. It is our belief that more people deserve to tap into the abundant natural kinetic energy which spontaneously envelops them, yet evades their grasp. Unlike stable sources of sustainable energy such as solar and biomass, the mostly ephemeral nature of wind and its unpredictable availability presents an additional challenge to the adoption of wind power. To address this problem, the central tenet of the design was for the wind turbine to be a vertical axis configuration, able to deliver a usable amount of power in erratic and turbulent wind conditions, and placing it in a niche apart from the more common horizontal axis wind turbines which require 'clean' airflow in specific locations to operate properly.

Drawing from experience gained from large bespoke outdoor installation projects, the design is focused on simplicity and ruggedness, capable of being installed and mantained in the widest of environmental conditions, and with minimal support.

Proven methods and materials from a range of different industries are combined in a novel way to ensure a consistent and trouble-free construction process and to provide reliable operation, in line with our vision of doing good in the world through increasing quality, be it of our products or of the lives of people.

The design is centered on the novel 5-phase, counter rotating electrical generator, first proven in 2013: https://www.facebook.com/carmatic/videos/vb.502... . A major decision was for a magnetic bearing effect to be implemented in the design, where the vertical load from the weight of the wind turbine is not borne by a mechanical rotating joint, and that the same magnets which induce the alternating current in the electrical generator also be utilized for this purpose. This contactless movement bypasses the problems of a traditional thrust bearing joint such as the requirement for lubrication and the associated vulnerability to damage from foreign objects and weathering, loss of efficiency from friction, and noise. Furthermore, by combining structural and electrical functions to the same magnets, the entire wind turbine is reduced to 2 moving parts, lowering the bill of materials and the cost of upkeep.  We have the capability to engineer the electric generator-bearing to a high degree of confidence and quality through the use of finite element analysis:
The feasibility of building the wind turbine based on these concepts at a realistic location has been validated using a Savonius rotor, built from recycled barrels:
The vertical axis format allows the wind turbine to act as a form of persistence of vision display:

The implementation of electronics into the rotor sections allows them to become smart aerodynamic elements. Currently, as a persistence of vision display, the installed electronics are digitally-controlled LED's, but future developments will use similarly installed solenoids and sensors which can actuate and sense the position of a flexible control surface, unlocking new levels of digitally-controlled wind energy capture potential.
We have also an ongoing project with Jambo Charity in Nairobi, Kenya to provide free wind-powered electricity to the surrounding community:
These wind turbines are built with materials and expertise sourced locally.
We are looking to collaborate with more charity organizations all over the world.

In these early versions of the wind turbine, the electrical generator-bearing is configured such that the heavier weight of the rotor is supported at the cost of the power output, which was sufficient to charge a mobile phone. The Savonius rotor is utilizes aerodynamic drag to produce rotation, thus limiting its rotation speed and the amount of power it can produce.
We are currently developing a new and more powerful wind turbine based on a Darrieus rotor as can be seen in the main video, and this confers a number of advantages:
• The light weight allows the electrical generator-bearing to be biased towards generating more electricity, increasing efficiency and reducing cost.

• The Darrieus airfoils are based on principles of aerodynamic lift, as opposed to the crude aerodynamic drag of the Savonius turbine. This translates into a more efficient conversion of air speed into rotor movement, and the Darrieus airfoils travel faster than the wind, even in the direction away from the wind. The increased rate of rotation also increases the mechanical to electrical conversion efficiency of the electrical generator.

An inherent disadvantage of the Darrieus design is that the airfoils require a narrow range of angles at which they are exposed to the wind in order for the lift effect , and hence the rotation of the rotor, to occur. If the airfoils were made to be simple and straight, they would leave gaps in the wind direction in which the turbine will fail to spin. This issue is rectified geometrically by fashioning the airfoils into helical shapes, resulting in a complete coverage of angles at which the aerodynamic lift effect would occur. However, achieving this shape requires specific construction methods which are not commonly used for creating simpler shapes. We have devised a simple way of creating such helical shapes : By using flexible materials, we can combine a bend and a twist to form a helical shape, and by making it conform to a 3D printed and CNC machined bending jig, we can achieve a precisely correct helix. The materials are then encased in fiberglass which gives the final structure, while the internal tension of the flexible materials will counteract centrifugal forces during high rates rotation, enhancing the strength and safety of the design.

Our first wind turbine of this new design will be built YouFactory in Lyon, France. http://youfactory.co/ because the maker space allows us to access rapid prototyping machines and tools, accelerating the development processes and rectifying mistakes in a productive manner. YouFactory also provides technical expertise assistance and a space for testing new methods, making it vital for the progress and innovation of the project as a whole.

The completed wind turbine will be exhibited as an art installation in Boom Festival www.boomfestival.org , making use of its implementation as a persistence of vision display in a decorative context. We believe that this is the most appropriate step in this stage of development, for a number of reasons:
• It is an opportunity to raise awareness of the wind turbine project, expanding our business influence and increasing our outreach.

• The festival has an emphasis on renewable energy and has been developed according to sustainable principles, thus it is a suitable model for the installation and usage of the wind turbine in a more realistic context.
• Various aspects of the wind turbine, such as the aerodynamic properties, have not been refined, and the non-critical nature of the festival is an ideal incubating environment for the wind turbine.
The bill of materials for this wind turbine can be viewed on this online spreadsheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17lMk__s...
The total costs of this project are as follows:
As you can see, our immediate expenses are €1720. In addition to covering these costs, your contributions will fund future development, namely:
• Computational fluid dynamics study of the aerodynamic properties.
Focus is given to three inter-related areas:
• Cost savings: Minimizing materials usage and wastage, reducing complexity of the design and construction, and cutting down on external expenses.
• Ecological sustainability: Green and recyclable material choices, accountable manufacturing practices, and closed loop flow of materials.
• Longetivity: Minimizing mantainence requirements and having a sustainable service plan.
In addition to these technical efforts, we will research on methods which will allow us to continue using locally sourced materials and expertise, thus making these objectives more viable.

Of particular note is our access to the YouFactory maker space, this allows us to manufacture objects with an almost arbitary shape within a limited range of materials and sizes. As such, we can offer a number of Indiegogo perks, please check them out and see if they interest you!
Keep an eye on this project, more perks may come along as development continues!

column2: >If we do not reach our goal:

column1: Any money raised will go towards furthering the development of this project. There are no set deadlines, and the project will continue, albeit at a slower pace. We will honour all the perks we promised :)

The money you give us will enable us to bring a product with a new paradigm to market. More importantly, this product will in turn provide another option of free electricity for those who cannot afford such a basic necessity. Our projected business model is as such:
• Sell wind turbines with cosmetic and vanity features to an economically viable demographic, creating a niche which taps into the drive for sustainability and renewable energy.

• With the profit from the above, make specialized models of wind turbines to be donated to select communities based on their income level, the level of wind, the viability of the installation, and a number of other factors.

• The above two activities will expand our outreach to more potential clients and markets. Continued research and intellectual property development, particularly on the electrical generator-bearing and smart airfoil concept. We will endeavour to share our development and designs to the masses.

• With our position in the market and industry, we establish relationships with suppliers and partners in order to further our goals. In particular, we will seek suppliers involved in recycled, ethically sourced and/or high technology materials.

column2: >As you can see, when you give money, you are not just contributing to a product, you are financing a persistent project with potentially long term consequences.

column1: The goals of ecological sustainability and cost savings are often contradictory. We will endeavour to mitigate this challenge and present the best balance of values in this wind turbine.

Furthermore, the magnets are the majority of the cost in the windmill, and the design of the electrical generator bearing calls for specific dimensions and shapes which may not be available, obliging the use of more costly custom-made magnets. As such, this is a possible cause of budget overruns. Our goal is to use recycled and recovered magnetic materials so that we do not rely on the continued extraction of materials from the earth.

Above all, we require continued access to work spaces for the forseeable future, and losing access means an immediate halt to the project.  As this access most likely requires the payment of a fee in the short and medium term, it is imperative that we have access to funds to be able to continue our work.
We thank you for reading this far! And please donate, if not for our perks, then just for knowing that you have helped a bunch of people who have realistic hopes and specific dreams.
Indiegogo suggests that this campaign be shared with people you know, so please do! We would appreciate all the attention and publicity we can get :)
We are Tai Chow Sing and Siwar Amri , and we are based in Lyon, France.

Since 2011, we have been developing a new type of wind turbine to address the shortfalls which prevent more people from harnessing wind power. It is our belief that more people deserve to tap into the abundant natural kinetic energy which spontaneously envelops them, yet evades their grasp. Unlike stable sources of sustainable energy such as solar and biomass, the mostly ephemeral nature of wind and its unpredictable availability presents an additional challenge to the adoption of wind power. To address this problem, the central tenet of the design was for the wind turbine to be a vertical axis configuration, able to deliver a usable amount of power in erratic and turbulent wind conditions, and placing it in a niche apart from the more common horizontal axis wind turbines which require 'clean' airflow in specific locations to operate properly.

Drawing from experience gained from large bespoke outdoor installation projects, the design is focused on simplicity and ruggedness, capable of being installed and mantained in the widest of environmental conditions, and with minimal support.

Proven methods and materials from a range of different industries are combined in a novel way to ensure a consistent and trouble-free construction process and to provide reliable operation, in line with our vision of doing good in the world through increasing quality, be it of our products or of the lives of people.

The design is centered on the novel 5-phase, counter rotating electrical generator, first proven in 2013: https://www.facebook.com/carmatic/videos/vb.502... . A major decision was for a magnetic bearing effect to be implemented in the design, where the vertical load from the weight of the wind turbine is not borne by a mechanical rotating joint, and that the same magnets which induce the alternating current in the electrical generator also be utilized for this purpose. This contactless movement bypasses the problems of a traditional thrust bearing joint such as the requirement for lubrication and the associated vulnerability to damage from foreign objects and weathering, loss of efficiency from friction, and noise. Furthermore, by combining structural and electrical functions to the same magnets, the entire wind turbine is reduced to 2 moving parts, lowering the bill of materials and the cost of upkeep.  We have the capability to engineer the electric generator-bearing to a high degree of confidence and quality through the use of finite element analysis:
The feasibility of building the wind turbine based on these concepts at a realistic location has been validated using a Savonius rotor, built from recycled barrels:
The vertical axis format allows the wind turbine to act as a form of persistence of vision display:

The implementation of electronics into the rotor sections allows them to become smart aerodynamic elements. Currently, as a persistence of vision display, the installed electronics are digitally-controlled LED's, but future developments will use similarly installed solenoids and sensors which can actuate and sense the position of a flexible control surface, unlocking new levels of digitally-controlled wind energy capture potential.
We have also an ongoing project with Jambo Charity in Nairobi, Kenya to provide free wind-powered electricity to the surrounding community:
These wind turbines are built with materials and expertise sourced locally.
We are looking to collaborate with more charity organizations all over the world.

In these early versions of the wind turbine, the electrical generator-bearing is configured such that the heavier weight of the rotor is supported at the cost of the power output, which was sufficient to charge a mobile phone. The Savonius rotor is utilizes aerodynamic drag to produce rotation, thus limiting its rotation speed and the amount of power it can produce.
What We Need & What You Get
We are currently developing a new and more powerful wind turbine based on a Darrieus rotor as can be seen in the main video, and this confers a number of advantages:
The light weight allows the electrical generator-bearing to be biased towards generating more electricity, increasing efficiency and reducing cost.

The Darrieus airfoils are based on principles of aerodynamic lift, as opposed to the crude aerodynamic drag of the Savonius turbine. This translates into a more efficient conversion of air speed into rotor movement, and the Darrieus airfoils travel faster than the wind, even in the direction away from the wind. The increased rate of rotation also increases the mechanical to electrical conversion efficiency of the electrical generator.

An inherent disadvantage of the Darrieus design is that the airfoils require a narrow range of angles at which they are exposed to the wind in order for the lift effect , and hence the rotation of the rotor, to occur. If the airfoils were made to be simple and straight, they would leave gaps in the wind direction in which the turbine will fail to spin. This issue is rectified geometrically by fashioning the airfoils into helical shapes, resulting in a complete coverage of angles at which the aerodynamic lift effect would occur. However, achieving this shape requires specific construction methods which are not commonly used for creating simpler shapes. We have devised a simple way of creating such helical shapes : By using flexible materials, we can combine a bend and a twist to form a helical shape, and by making it conform to a 3D printed and CNC machined bending jig, we can achieve a precisely correct helix. The materials are then encased in fiberglass which gives the final structure, while the internal tension of the flexible materials will counteract centrifugal forces during high rates rotation, enhancing the strength and safety of the design.

Our first wind turbine of this new design will be built YouFactory in Lyon, France. http://youfactory.co/ because the maker space allows us to access rapid prototyping machines and tools, accelerating the development processes and rectifying mistakes in a productive manner. YouFactory also provides technical expertise assistance and a space for testing new methods, making it vital for the progress and innovation of the project as a whole.

The completed wind turbine will be exhibited as an art installation in Boom Festival www.boomfestival.org , making use of its implementation as a persistence of vision display in a decorative context. We believe that this is the most appropriate step in this stage of development, for a number of reasons:
It is an opportunity to raise awareness of the wind turbine project, expanding our business influence and increasing our outreach.

The festival has an emphasis on renewable energy and has been developed according to sustainable principles, thus it is a suitable model for the installation and usage of the wind turbine in a more realistic context.
Various aspects of the wind turbine, such as the aerodynamic properties, have not been refined, and the non-critical nature of the festival is an ideal incubating environment for the wind turbine.
The bill of materials for this wind turbine can be viewed on this online spreadsheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17lMk__s...
The total costs of this project are as follows:
As you can see, our immediate expenses are €1720. In addition to covering these costs, your contributions will fund future development, namely:
Continued development of the electrical generator-bearing.
Computational fluid dynamics study of the aerodynamic properties.
Focus is given to three inter-related areas:
Cost savings: Minimizing materials usage and wastage, reducing complexity of the design and construction, and cutting down on external expenses.
Ecological sustainability: Green and recyclable material choices, accountable manufacturing practices, and closed loop flow of materials.
Longetivity: Minimizing mantainence requirements and having a sustainable service plan.
In addition to these technical efforts, we will research on methods which will allow us to continue using locally sourced materials and expertise, thus making these objectives more viable.

Of particular note is our access to the YouFactory maker space, this allows us to manufacture objects with an almost arbitary shape within a limited range of materials and sizes. As such, we can offer a number of Indiegogo perks, please check them out and see if they interest you!
Keep an eye on this project, more perks may come along as development continues!
If we do not reach our goal:

Any money raised will go towards furthering the development of this project. There are no set deadlines, and the project will continue, albeit at a slower pace. We will honour all the perks we promised :)

The money you give us will enable us to bring a product with a new paradigm to market. More importantly, this product will in turn provide another option of free electricity for those who cannot afford such a basic necessity. Our projected business model is as such:
Sell wind turbines with cosmetic and vanity features to an economically viable demographic, creating a niche which taps into the drive for sustainability and renewable energy.

With the profit from the above, make specialized models of wind turbines to be donated to select communities based on their income level, the level of wind, the viability of the installation, and a number of other factors.

The above two activities will expand our outreach to more potential clients and markets. Continued research and intellectual property development, particularly on the electrical generator-bearing and smart airfoil concept. We will endeavour to share our development and designs to the masses.

With our position in the market and industry, we establish relationships with suppliers and partners in order to further our goals. In particular, we will seek suppliers involved in recycled, ethically sourced and/or high technology materials.
As you can see, when you give money, you are not just contributing to a product, you are financing a persistent project with potentially long term consequences.
The goals of ecological sustainability and cost savings are often contradictory. We will endeavour to mitigate this challenge and present the best balance of values in this wind turbine.

Furthermore, the magnets are the majority of the cost in the windmill, and the design of the electrical generator bearing calls for specific dimensions and shapes which may not be available, obliging the use of more costly custom-made magnets. As such, this is a possible cause of budget overruns. Our goal is to use recycled and recovered magnetic materials so that we do not rely on the continued extraction of materials from the earth.

Above all, we require continued access to work spaces for the forseeable future, and losing access means an immediate halt to the project.  As this access most likely requires the payment of a fee in the short and medium term, it is imperative that we have access to funds to be able to continue our work.
We thank you for reading this far! And please donate, if not for our perks, then just for knowing that you have helped a bunch of people who have realistic hopes and specific dreams.

Soleco House is a company that offers cottages made of modern and innovative materials – eco-panels.

The uncontrolled consumption of energy resources leads to the aggravation of the ecological situation.  The constant increase in the price of these resources consumes a large part of the income of any family. The only way out is to minimize the consumption of gas, electricity and other heating resources. How is it possible? We can not influence the weather outside, yet we want our family to live in comfortable conditions. Therefore, the house should be as energy-efficient as possible, which means modern technology should be used during construction.

Eco-panels – one of the solutions used during the construction of houses. What is it? Eco-panels are straw based panels. A pressed straw (the density of which is 140kg/m³) is laid into a wooden frame which is impregnated with antibacterial substances. Both sides of the frame are concealed with a layer of clay plaster. As a result, a lightweight and reliable block is obtained that is designed to hold 27 tons of vertical load and has high thermal insulation properties. Another positive aspect of the material is that houses can be constructed in various climatic zones, including seismic hazard zones. Since the walls are made of such material they are elastic, mobile and without the risk of collapse.
Why Soleco House? Our houses have a number of advantages:

• Energy-efficiency. The pressed straw has low thermal conductivity. Houses constructed from this material require five times less energy for heating in winter and cooling in summer, than houses built from ordinary materials. For example, if the house has an area of  100m², then it consumes only 1500 kW of energy per year.
• Strength. The estimated vertical load of 27 tons makes it possible for the panels to reliably support the ceiling and roof and withstand extreme loads during earthquakes.

• Durability. We can guarantee selected high-quality natural materials, the estimation of blocks and their production in strict accordance with the technology. The houses built by Soleco House will serve for five generations.

• Ecological compatibility. Straw is an environmentally friendly material. Chemical binders such as resins, adhesives, etc. are not used in the manufacture of blocks, as it may emit harmful substances. The humidity of houses made of eco-panels is 60%, which creates a healthy microclimate without the need of forced ventilation.

Now you do not need to postpone life for later. If your dream is to have your own house, but you are stopped by material considerations, that is, you are afraid that you lack financial resources to build or maintain this house – now everything has changed! We offer you a house for the price of an apartment. The area and layout of the house will depend solely on your desires. Thanks to the fantastic properties of the simple and affordable material from which your house will be built, the cost of utilities will be reduced to a minimum. Contact us, and we will tell you where to start the path to your own home.

Our company will be with you during all stages of building your home: we will create the drafts and working projects, we will produce eco-blocks for the construction and afterwards assemble the house on your land lot.
1. Is the house suitable for year-round living? Maybe this is an option only for a garden house?

This house is much warmer than a house built from traditional materials. Straw is a very warm material. Furthermore, in an ordinary home there is a constant decrease of heat due to ventilation. The structure of the straw does not interfere with gas exchange. The house „breathes”, thus  no ventilation is required.
2. Yes, but will this „breathing” cause chill and drafts in the house?

No, it is immpossible. Due to the fibrous structure of the straw all gas exchange processes take place at a molecular level. There will not be chill and draft in the eco-cube itself. It is easy to verify if you try to pierce it with a needle, it will be impossible. The accurate measurements of the blocks and the protection of seams with special lath will not allow cracks to form.
3. Straw is easily flammable. Will the house be safe?

The dense pressed straw prevents oxygen from getting inside the unit. Also, the fire resistance of the block is increased by clay plaster. Within an hour, the wall block is able to resists an open fire with a temperature of 800-1000 ° C, which corresponds to the properties of concrete structures. The fire resistance of the eco-blocks is REI 60.
4. We can escape the sounds from the outside world only in our home behind secure walls. Will the „straw” house give the necessary protection?

The thickness of the walls, floor and roof are slightly less than half meter, which ensures the protection from external noises. You will feel comfortable in the house as the degree of sound insulation is 56 dB.
5. How long will it take to build my house?

Blocks are produced in a specialized workshop. If the house has an area of 100 m² the production of blocks will last for one month. The assembly of the house on the lath takes a few days and requires only 2-3 people. You can order the blocks in winter and the assembly can be done as soon as the weather is beneficial.

column2: >As you can see, it is possible to become a happy owner of your own eco-friendly and affordable house for reasonable money in a short time. All you have to do is to contact Soleco House and we give you our technology for free

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Save your phone and the planet - in style

 

Most people don’t realize that by charging their smart phones and tablets overnight they are harming the battery and shortening the lifespan of the phone. Letting the battery drop to nearly 0% and then overcharging for too long, is a sure way to degrade the device way faster than necessary. 

 

CLOU to the rescue

Green chargeis a brand new technology that extends the life of your smart phone battery and recharges it at the right time. CLOUdoes exactly that - automatically.

 

Welcome to green charge technology

The CLOUsmart charger helps you keep your phone charged between 20% - 80%, making it last a lot longer. Whenever a battery is at a too low level or is recharging over 80% the ion degrading is rapid. CLOUsolves that.

The way to make your phone last longer is to charge it in intervals during the day (a small amount of boosting). The best way to do that is by keeping the level of charge in the phone at between 20% - 80%. By doing so, the battery life can increase way into the future.

 

 

The amazing thing is that CLOUis small enough to have in your pocket and it weighs a fraction of a typical battery bank.

 

Temperature management is the key to success

The wrong temperature during charging degrades your battery. The secret to CLOU’s success is advanced electronic intelligence that protects the batteries in both your smart phone and in CLOUitself. The electronics controls the charging cycles in small 4 minutes intervals and then pauses for 2 minutes, keeping the phone and charger at optimal operating and charging temperatures. You can override this safe charge mode by a simple press of a button.

CLOU boosts the number of times you can recharge your phone from about 350 - 500 to at least 900 - 1200 times. This effect extends the lifespan of your phone, way into the future.

The PCB - advanced electronics
column3:
showinfo=0"">

 

The PCB in clou, includes a micro computer, that make sure that, the batteri never uses below 15% - nor 92% og the clou batteri. So the clou only operates between 15% - 92 %. This means more cycles. A safety circuit: The electronics also includes a timer funktion, making the clou charge for 4 minutes and rest for 2 min, this minimising the temperature increase but still a functional phone, the timer function will also cut of the input signal, ( when cloud is plugged into your phone and charging from a wall outlet at the same time)

If you dont have time to run a safety circuit you can press the ”on” button and clou will be running agian, the more you let the safety cirket run, the more the batteri stays healty

 

 

Made for YOUR phone

No matter what type of smart phone you have, there is a CLOU for you. When you back our kickstarter, you can choose either USB-C, Apple lightning or micro-USB.

A quality finish

Timeless solutions also means using sustainable, environmentally correct materials that will maintain their beauty throughout the years. 

One of the two main materials using in CLOUis fine aluminium, a very sustainable and recyclable material. Aluminium gives CLOUit’s unbeatable light-weight finish. The other material is leather. 100% organic and of the finest Danish quality, which is internationally renowned. These two finishes in combination gives you a fantastic tactile quality - a great-to-hold-in-you-hand feeling.

 

Why does green charging matter?

If you have bought a new phone and charge it overnight while you are sleeping, degrading will happen within a year. So the battery your phone will be healthy for about the first 12 months. It can still be used, but the ion capacity is not as good as it could be.

 

 

You get tired of the phone discharging too quickly, without considering why it happens. After some time you simply decide to buy a new phone.

Smart phone manufacturers know this, and it is one of the reasons there is a new model version every year.

 

One of the main reasons for discarding your phone is because of the battery. Yet a modern mobile phone also contains silver, copper, gold and palladium.

In fact, it is said that a smartphone is made up of more than 40 basic elements, that are sourced around the planet, including from Chinese and African mines. Here, metals are washed out of crushed stone using strong chemicals that creates problematic mining waste. 

A lot of energy is also used in refining the metals, before they can be used as raw materials in your mobile phone.

 

 

 

BUT, if you take care of the phone and its battery, your phone  will last longer and be worth more when you resell it - helping the environment and saving you money while you own it - and making you money when you sell it.

 

If CLOUcan help extend the lifespan or reuse 1 out of every 4 mobile phones on a worldwide basis that will result in a reduction of greenhouses gasses equivalent to 4 million cars.

 

Why not wireless charging?

Wireless charging is much less efficient than wired charging

Wireless charging would be an obvious technical choice for CLOU. However we found that while wireless charging is convenient for some users, the technology is not yet mature enough at this stage. Induction wastes an inordinately large amount of power and that defeats our environmental goals completely. However in the not too distant future, when wireless charging becomes more advanced, we will introduce an Induction CLOU. In the meantime, the best solution is the plug-in CLOUwe have now. CLOUputs the precise amount of power you need exactly where you need it

 

Packaging

When you buy a new smartphone, it comes in sophisticated packaging which has several functions. Protection during transport, nudging the customer and aiding sales.

All packaging has an environmental footprint. Most often smart phones are packaged in cardboard and plastic. Plastics are made from oil-based petrochemicals which are fossil-fuels and harmful for the environment. Cardboard is a tree-based material. Trees can be grown sustainably, but this is not always the case.

CLOUis packaged in sustainable materials from environmentally responsible sources. In addition, some of the packaging is designed for re-use so that it need not even be discarded.

 

 

 

Designed and manufactured in Denmark

CLOUis made of sustainable materials sourced in Denmark. It contains original components, and last but certainly not least, the world’s smallest and most powerful battery from Panasonic.

The development, design and engineering are all done in Denmark. The electronics and software developed by Danish engineers. The materials are all sourced locally and are of the finest quality. The manufacturing is done both by robots and by hand by skilled craftsmen, all in Denmark.

The power consumption and energy used in the development, testing and production come from wind turbines and is CO2 neutral. Denmark is one of the planet’s leading design nations, creating world class, timeless solutions for centuries.

 

Danish is a pastry isn’t it? Why is Denmark the place to start this vision?

Denmark is one of the world’s leading nations in combating climate change. 

CLOUis not only conceived as a next generation intelligent product, it also engineered and produced in that way.

northern Europe's largest solar plant 3 km from our base

 

· Denmark is in forefront of many environmental fields.

· Denmark has the ability and surplus to develop a product with high design qualities.

· Denmark can be likened to a European Silicon Valley of the environment.

Denmark is an affluent society in which every process in the development and production line is compensated for in relation to the environment and sustainability.

 

Our mission

Reload World’s mission is to be the first and only company that will help you understand your phone and to treat your phones in a much better way.

In 2021 smartphones are more expensive than televisions. There is a big interest in learning how to use them properly because the phone is not just a phone anymore.

 

 Reload World’s mission is to take this science and teach you good battery care. For the sake of the climate, and your bank account, you have to take care of your smartphone and everything else that contains a battery, just as you do with other things in life.

You use your phone for almost everything. Your phone is used for many more things than just making calls or navigating with GPS. Within the last couple of years, it has become your daily digital wallet. Your phone has become a method for payment. It has also become your digital bus ticket or boarding pass. You can even unlock the door to your house, switch on and off the lights or alarms.

It is a paradox that despite its usefulness approximately 150 million smart phones are discarded each year in the USA alone. An enormous waste of resources and technology!

We want to help change that!

","Save your phone and the planet - in style Most people don’t realize that by charging their smart phones and tablets overnight they are harming the battery and shortening the lifespan of the phone. Letting the battery drop to nearly 0% and then overcharging for too long, is a sure way to degrade the device way faster than necessary.  CLOU to the rescueGreen chargeis a brand new technology that extends the life of your smart phone battery and recharges it at the right time. CLOUdoes exactly that - automatically. Welcome to green charge technologyThe CLOUsmart charger helps you keep your phone charged between 20% - 80%, making it last a lot longer. Whenever a battery is at a too low level or is recharging over 80% the ion degrading is rapid. CLOUsolves that.The way to make your phone last longer is to charge it in intervals during the day (a small amount of boosting). The best way to do that is by keeping the level of charge in the phone at between 20% - 80%. By doing so, the battery life can increase way into the future.  The amazing thing is that CLOUis small enough to have in your pocket and it weighs a fraction of a typical battery bank. Temperature management is the key to successThe wrong temperature during charging degrades your battery. The secret to CLOU’s success is advanced electronic intelligence that protects the batteries in both your smart phone and in CLOUitself. The electronics controls the charging cycles in small 4 minutes intervals and then pauses for 2 minutes, keeping the phone and charger at optimal operating and charging temperatures. You can override this safe charge mode by a simple press of a button.CLOU boosts the number of times you can recharge your phone from about 350 - 500 to at least 900 - 1200 times. This effect extends the lifespan of your phone, way into the future.The PCB - advanced electronics The PCB in clou, includes a micro computer, that make sure that, the batteri never uses below 15% - nor 92% og the clou batteri. So the clou only operates between 15% - 92 %. This means more cycles. A safety circuit: The electronics also includes a timer funktion, making the clou charge for 4 minutes and rest for 2 min, this minimising the temperature increase but still a functional phone, the timer function will also cut of the input signal, ( when cloud is plugged into your phone and charging from a wall outlet at the same time)If you dont have time to run a safety circuit you can press the ”on” button and clou will be running agian, the more you let the safety cirket run, the more the batteri stays healty  Made for YOUR phoneNo matter what type of smart phone you have, there is a CLOU for you. When you back our kickstarter, you can choose either USB-C, Apple lightning or micro-USB.A quality finishTimeless solutions also means using sustainable, environmentally correct materials that will maintain their beauty throughout the years. One of the two main materials using in CLOUis fine aluminium, a very sustainable and recyclable material. Aluminium gives CLOUit’s unbeatable light-weight finish. The other material is leather. 100% organic and of the finest Danish quality, which is internationally renowned. These two finishes in combination gives you a fantastic tactile quality - a great-to-hold-in-you-hand feeling. Why does green charging matter?If you have bought a new phone and charge it overnight while you are sleeping, degrading will happen within a year. So the battery your phone will be healthy for about the first 12 months. It can still be used, but the ion capacity is not as good as it could be.  You get tired of the phone discharging too quickly, without considering why it happens. After some time you simply decide to buy a new phone.Smart phone manufacturers know this, and it is one of the reasons there is a new model version every year. One of the main reasons for discarding your phone is because of the battery. Yet a modern mobile phone also contains silver, copper, gold and palladium.In fact, it is said that a smartphone is made up of more than 40 basic elements, that are sourced around the planet, including from Chinese and African mines. Here, metals are washed out of crushed stone using strong chemicals that creates problematic mining waste. A lot of energy is also used in refining the metals, before they can be used as raw materials in your mobile phone.   BUT, if you take care of the phone and its battery, your phone  will last longer and be worth more when you resell it - helping the environment and saving you money while you own it - and making you money when you sell it. If CLOUcan help extend the lifespan or reuse 1 out of every 4 mobile phones on a worldwide basis that will result in a reduction of greenhouses gasses equivalent to 4 million cars. Why not wireless charging?Wireless charging is much less efficient than wired chargingWireless charging would be an obvious technical choice for CLOU. However we found that while wireless charging is convenient for some users, the technology is not yet mature enough at this stage. Induction wastes an inordinately large amount of power and that defeats our environmental goals completely. However in the not too distant future, when wireless charging becomes more advanced, we will introduce an Induction CLOU. In the meantime, the best solution is the plug-in CLOUwe have now. CLOUputs the precise amount of power you need exactly where you need it PackagingWhen you buy a new smartphone, it comes in sophisticated packaging which has several functions. Protection during transport, nudging the customer and aiding sales.All packaging has an environmental footprint. Most often smart phones are packaged in cardboard and plastic. Plastics are made from oil-based petrochemicals which are fossil-fuels and harmful for the environment. Cardboard is a tree-based material. Trees can be grown sustainably, but this is not always the case.CLOUis packaged in sustainable materials from environmentally responsible sources. In addition, some of the packaging is designed for re-use so that it need not even be discarded.   Designed and manufactured in DenmarkCLOUis made of sustainable materials sourced in Denmark. It contains original components, and last but certainly not least, the world’s smallest and most powerful battery from Panasonic.The development, design and engineering are all done in Denmark. The electronics and software developed by Danish engineers. The materials are all sourced locally and are of the finest quality. The manufacturing is done both by robots and by hand by skilled craftsmen, all in Denmark.The power consumption and energy used in the development, testing and production come from wind turbines and is CO2 neutral. Denmark is one of the planet’s leading design nations, creating world class, timeless solutions for centuries. Danish is a pastry isn’t it? Why is Denmark the place to start this vision?Denmark is one of the world’s leading nations in combating climate change. CLOUis not only conceived as a next generation intelligent product, it also engineered and produced in that way.northern Europe's largest solar plant 3 km from our base · Denmark is in forefront of many environmental fields.· Denmark has the ability and surplus to develop a product with high design qualities.· Denmark can be likened to a European Silicon Valley of the environment.Denmark is an affluent society in which every process in the development and production line is compensated for in relation to the environment and sustainability. Our missionReload World’s mission is to be the first and only company that will help you understand your phone and to treat your phones in a much better way.In 2021 smartphones are more expensive than televisions. There is a big interest in learning how to use them properly because the phone is not just a phone anymore.  Reload World’s mission is to take this science and teach you good battery care. For the sake of the climate, and your bank account, you have to take care of your smartphone and everything else that contains a battery, just as you do with other things in life.You use your phone for almost everything. Your phone is used for many more things than just making calls or navigating with GPS. Within the last couple of years, it has become your daily digital wallet. Your phone has become a method for payment. It has also become your digital bus ticket or boarding pass. You can even unlock the door to your house, switch on and off the lights or alarms.It is a paradox that despite its usefulness approximately 150 million smart phones are discarded each year in the USA alone. SolCube - compact solar generator for power lovers

SolCube powers your most needed electrical appliances like fridges and computers anytime anywhere. It is a plug and play solar system with integrated battery and electronics to convert energy from solar modules into electricity for daily use. With SolCube you turn any place off the grid into a comfortable home. Spend less time with installation and more time with your loved ones.
column2:
>

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

How it works

In only 3 steps you now can generate your own solar energy:

column1:
Collect sunlight

Place solar modules into the sun to collect sunlight. Face your solar modules directly to the sun. Whenever sunlight hits the surface of the solar modules they generate power. SolCube stores that solar energy and converts it to electricity for daily use.
column3:
ssl=1"" src="""" style=""""/>

Larger solar modules charge faster because they catch more sunlight. And if charging with one solar module is not fast enough for you, we gave SolCube a second module slot. Two solar modules double the charging speed.

We recommend using ultra-lightweight modules that are easy to handle and can be fixed on many places. Solar modules with a frame may be placed on the ground in different angles. That helps you move the solar module along with the the sun at different times of the day.

Naked solar modules without the frame can easily be attached to flat surface like walls and roofs.
column4:
>

 

Plug in cables

The connection cable between solar module and SolCube can be up to 15 meters. Enough to place the solar module into the sun and SolCube inside your newly solar powered outpost. Whenever sunlight hits the surface of the solar modules then SolCube charges. The -A- display will show you, how fast the battery is charging.
column6:
ssl=1"" src="""" style=""""/>

 

Power on!

Run your most needed appliances anytime anywhere. When running appliances, keep an eye on the battery indicator. Some appliances only need very little power, others empty your battery quickly.
column8:
ssl=1"" src="""" style=""""/>

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Technical Data

SolCube is the personal solar generator that suits your needs. We prepared 4 versions and 8 colors to help you power your most needed appliances.

column2:
Download technical data sheet (PDF)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

SolMates are power lovers

SolMates are people like you and me. They share the same passion for solar energy. SolMates now power their most needed appliances with solar energy only. Anytime anywhere. Sweet!
column3: >Solar power for cabins in the woods
column9: >Solar power for heavy tools at the shack
column12: >Solar power just for fun
column15:
> 

 

How far will fully charged SolCubes get you?

Every SolMate wants to power different appliances. Some power fridges, some charge smartphones, others want to drink hot tea. That is why we build personal solar generators. Each SolCube has different capabilities.

 

Charges with SolCube Basic
column16:
>

 

Charges with SolCube Ultra

 

Larger solar modules charge faster

SolCube Ultra has 3 times the battery size of a SolCube Basic. So it takes 3 times longer to charge it when it is empty. To boost charging time, use larger solar modules.

 

SolCube Assistant helps you find out about your personal situation

Want to test your most needed appliances with different cubes?

Go to https://base.energy/solcube/assistant and find out, which SolCube is right for you!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Components

Solar modules and frames

Handmade Accessories

Use SolCube as stool to sit on with a comfortable pillow. Within the handmade bag you can keep your cables and plugs that you frequently use.

 

Extension cables

Connect solar modules with SolCube. Place your Solar modules on a roof, at a wall or place them on the ground. Then connect your solar module with SolCube to charge it.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

column2:
>

Simon, 34

With more than a decade of experience in the solar industry, Simon realized many different solar projects all over Europe. He managed power generators ranging from a single solar module to large scale power plants providing thousands of homes and small business with renewable energy.

From 2014 to 2016 Simon created an innovative plug and play solar module that is used on city balconies of more than 2.000 happy solar pioneers (www.simon.energy) . After collecting hundreds of requests from people who also need electricity off the grid, Simon decided to create the easiest and most personal solar power plant ever. SolCube was born.

Ferdinand, 25

At university Ferdinand developed computer simulations that help predict the reliability for solar systems off the grid. When his brother Simon asked him to team up, Ferdinand became obsessed to find the perfect system configuration for powering the most needed electrical appliances.

Ferdinand knows for sure that the way we organize food, water, energy and mobility will change significantly within the next one or two generations.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Taxes, Shipping &
column3:
Availability

If you claim a perk during our campaign please be aware, that taxes and fees may apply when importing SolCube and accessories into your country.

For recipients of perks within the European Union we will pay Austrian value added tax (VAT). For all other countries it is your responsibility to pay fees and taxes.

Availability

SolCube Basic is available in many countries. Please check the perks section to find out more.

Currently, SolCube Standard, SolCube Pro and SolCube Ultra are only available within the European Union. They contain large lithium batteries and may not be shipped by airplane.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Why solar power?

Electricity is indispensable at work and at home. It helps us through so much time of the day, that it is hard to imagine a life without power. How can we maintain affordable electricity for ourselves and also for our children? That is why solar power is so awesome. The energy is sent to earth free of charge, solar generators work silent without any pollution and the used materials can be recycled.

Solar surface needed to power the world

We found that solar power has been much more complicated than it needs to be. To get solar powered, people have spent much time and efforts to figure it all out. That is why we created SolCube. 

The sun already shines for everyone, You just need to use it!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Timeline

Short overview of milestones that were achieved in the past.

column1: • Summer 2016: Checked feasibility of solar only operation off the grid for many appliances
• October 2016: Finished software  program to simulate several SolCube hardware configurations like battery and module sizes
• March 2017: Prototype 3.0 finished, detailed testing off the grid
• July and August 2017: Fine tuning of small parts for internal wiring

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Help bring forward plug and play solar power!

Your contribution will have an impact. We are certain, that plug and play solar power will take a significant share in the future. Why spend time and money on other people mounting hardware when you can set it up yourself in only a few minutes?

Know someone else who can use SolCube? Tell them now!

With your contribution we will
• buy hardware in large quantities to offer a reasonable price per unit
• build personal solar generators for all you SolMates out there.

Power on!

Its 11 months from now since we arrived in the DR for a one year volunteering program. We are two german volunteers living in the south-western region of the DR in a little village called „La Descubierta“. Our job is bringing light to myriad houses where electricity is a rare good. How we achieve this: Our organisation „Litro de Luz RD“ or „Liter of Light RD“ is constructing and installing sustainable solar lamps which are already giving many families in different places of the DR the advantage to have their houses illuminated even when the light on the street is gone. Besides that giving environmental classes, including workshops on how to produce those solar lamps is another major part of the work they are accomplishing. La Descubierta : La Descubierta is a small village in one of the hottest and driest region of the country. There are living around 5 thousand people a lot of haitian people as well because of the close distance to the border. La Descubierta is surrounded by mountains where people are living in even smaller villages to work on agriculture farms. Most of those villages including „La Descubierta“ are connected to the power system of the country nevertheless having electricity all day long almost never happen. Normally the light comes for a few hours at afternoon and than passes by at night. When the light goes the fridge no longer works, the fan no longer works, but even worse the houses are getting pretty dark. The other villages more on the way up the mountains are not even connected to the power system. Some Families have a thing called: „Inversor“. Its a block of car batteries which can store a lot of energy but only when the light isn‘t gone. It costs about 140 US $ which most families can never effort. Flashlights are a lot cheaper but buying batteries every month can get expensive as well. Candles and gas lights have the same problems. So there come our lamps into play! Litro de Luz RD actually builds three different kinds of solar lamps:

 

The “Litro de Luz Noche“ is the most popular one which is directly installed into the roof of the house and gets charged by a solar panel automatically during daytime.

 

The “Litro de Luz Calle“ is a street light which illuminate streets automatically when the sunset sets in. It has a motorcycle battery which can store a lot of energy but still only gets charged by a solar panel.

 

The “Litro de Luz Móvil“ is a table desk lamp which is brighter than the House Lamp and has a separate solar panel which can get unplugged when there is no need to charge any longer. The Lamp is easily portable and can illuminate a room for six to eight hours when completely charged.

 

Besides the solar panel all the lamps are using recycled plastic bottles for the educational environmental aspect!

Our request:

In the last month we produced 28 of those table desk lights which we want to hand out to the people in „La Descubierta“ and the mountain villages. The cost of the materials for one lamp including the solar panel is about 24 US $. For the people especially in this region of the country it's a lot of money. So we want to collect 80 % of the money for 28 Lamps which are 537,6 US $ and the other 20% the families should be still worth to pay.

 

More Information about the project:

 

Check out Instagram: @litrodeluz_rd

Facebook: Un Litro de Luz República Dominicana

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! And that's all there is to it.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: We complete the purchase of the lakeside land where our Portuguese centre will be based.
Buy tools necessary for the training Centre to teach its courses.
Building the website, marketing, advertising, giving online talks, harnessing the interest at a time when many people are at home and able to make time to inquire. Securing administrative help.
Completing purchase small lakeside land base in Tomar, Portugal @ £5000
(1 shipping container storage unit @  £1,200 inc. delivery)
(Ann Gylman, Project Manager, has contributed £10,000 of her savings to secure the land base.)

Any funds over this amount will facilitate online presentations to create awareness and excitement around the concept of what is possible for them in the area of eco-self building. During this period when people are looking for new opportunities, we offer a vision for a brighter future.
Beyond £25,000 funds will be used as a reserve fund, for marketing and towards the courses and extending the land.
We look forward to going to colleges with introductory talks.
Website building, expanding the team, developing relationships with colleges, the media and customers,, as well as online introductions and teaching.
We look forward to spending set up time in Portugal with the local community furthering those supportive relationships and giving this project the time it deserves to develop successfully.
Some of the most accomplished UK trainers will be part of this project and glad to have the opportunity to work through winter months.  These are professional trainers with passion &
column2: expertise, teaching theory and practise of eco-building, bringing skills, pride and hope to young people and families.

column1: Automation of industry and commerce is allowing people to have more time, though possibly less money. This creates the opportunity to consider self-building your own home. Sharing this profound experience with family and friends makes lasting bonds, communities and strengthens relationships.
I'm Ann Gylman, I studied English Literature, I set up the first walk in pregnancy testing clinic in UK, in Leicester, so women could have an immediate result and privacy.
I worked in property management for some years until I founded my own property management company, which I sold to move to Brighton. It is still thriving today.

I've managed, refurbished and restored properties in the UK and in France. I trained in eco self-building with Brighton Permaculture Trust and I'm heading this project to transform the housing market. To create awareness of the benefits of self-building and to make it a mainstream choice.

Housing costs are a person's biggest regular outgoing, either mortgage or rent.  Young people are finding it increasingly difficult or impossible to finance, they don’t know how they’re going to pay for a home in the future. BUT, job automation, means less money BUT more time.
Bringing self-building into the mainstream as a valid choice, saves many thousands of pounds in costs and interest payments.
The great Mark Twain said, “Buy land, they’re not making it anymore.”
Our expectation is that we can be a viable business in 2 years.

A woman said recently she was out of work but wanted to contribute.  I asked her if she could give £1, she said yes, but was it worth it? We agreed it was and she would ask her friends to put in £1. She promised to send £10, and she did. We really appreciate that she did this and kickstarted this campaign. Please know that we value and appreciate every gesture of support.
Sponsors for this project are aware that changes are needed in the housing market.
UK statistics show prior to CV19 that 180 people daily were being evicted from their home.
Every contribution brings us closer to supporting people to self-build secure homes, youngsters, parents and grandparents are a powerful group financially and energetically.
The cost of eco self-building is affordable, without excessive mortgage debt.
Our intention is to bring ecological self-building into the mainstream, giving people purpose and choice.
Our contributors will be celebrated, remembered and  known for their foresight and generosity.
Heroes are the pioneers of this new paradigm - the researchers, the developers, the contributors to life that works for everyone.

CONCLUSION ~
Self and community building of sustainable eco-homes is perhaps the next bubble.
We promise to give information and trainings on how to build safe, long-lasting buildings in a community based on fellowship, humanity, teamwork, self-reliance and pride.

I’m imagining people with strong family values, philanthropists who are aware of social problems, and who are seeing a bigger picture.  They are adventurous, open to both old and new ideas for affordable, sustainable freehold, family housing, wanting old fashioned family values reinstated.

column2: >If we raise less than the full amount we will continue campaigning.
>We'll prepare as much as possible during the pandemic, knowing we are preparing information and putting plans in place for those who want to learn more about self-building
>My daughter said, ""When this is over, everyone will be running for the hills to self-build""
>Please share our campaign to as many people as possible, giving them the choice to contribute and learn about eco self-building.
>You could be opening a door for a friend or someone they know.
>Were looking forward to sharing our progress with you and to seeing you in Portugal in the future.

column1: PATÉ (Pure, Absolute, Totally, Eco) is a new business with a mission to train young people self-building eco-homes which are affordable, lasting and environmentally friendly.
Self-building is about building cheaply in an environmentally friendly way. Designing buildings that are sustainable from the outset, finding solutions, making the building sector fit for the future.
Our current project is setting up a teaching centre in Portugal  where weather allows all year trainings. In the UK we work from April to October as its outdoors work.

This training centre is where youngsters of all ages will carry out projects with appropriate, reusable materials such as earth, straw, wood and tyres. Learning skills for a quality of life which they may think is beyond their reach.
This new paradigm is going back to history, learning how to build a future that nourishes Earth and family life. Bringing self-building into the mainstream.
Our sponsors will know the value of peaceful coexistence with Earth balancing human life with natural resources and considering other species.
We intend trailblazing the homes market  with tested, life altering trainings, using traditional eco-building methods, old fashioned values, new possibilities for family life.
Self and community building of affordable eco-homes, just may be the next bubble.
Fantastic article - 'Earthly Powers' Louis Wustemann, Financial Times 21-22 March 2020
We complete the purchase of the lakeside land where our Portuguese centre will be based.
Buy tools necessary for the training Centre to teach its courses.
Building the website, marketing, advertising, giving online talks, harnessing the interest at a time when many people are at home and able to make time to inquire. Securing administrative help.
Completing purchase small lakeside land base in Tomar, Portugal @ £5000
(1 shipping container storage unit @  £1,200 inc. delivery)
Website, travel, legal fees, insurance & admin assistance £4,945
(Ann Gylman, Project Manager, has contributed £10,000 of her savings to secure the land base.)

Any funds over this amount will facilitate online presentations to create awareness and excitement around the concept of what is possible for them in the area of eco-self building. During this period when people are looking for new opportunities, we offer a vision for a brighter future.
Beyond £25,000 funds will be used as a reserve fund, for marketing and towards the courses and extending the land.
We look forward to going to colleges with introductory talks.
Website building, expanding the team, developing relationships with colleges, the media and customers,, as well as online introductions and teaching.
We look forward to spending set up time in Portugal with the local community furthering those supportive relationships and giving this project the time it deserves to develop successfully.

Some of the most accomplished UK trainers will be part of this project and glad to have the opportunity to work through winter months.  These are professional trainers with passion & expertise, teaching theory and practise of eco-building, bringing skills, pride and hope to young people and families.

Automation of industry and commerce is allowing people to have more time, though possibly less money. This creates the opportunity to consider self-building your own home. Sharing this profound experience with family and friends makes lasting bonds, communities and strengthens relationships.
I'm Ann Gylman, I studied English Literature, I set up the first walk in pregnancy testing clinic in UK, in Leicester, so women could have an immediate result and privacy.
I worked in property management for some years until I founded my own property management company, which I sold to move to Brighton. It is still thriving today.

I've managed, refurbished and restored properties in the UK and in France. I trained in eco self-building with Brighton Permaculture Trust and I'm heading this project to transform the housing market. To create awareness of the benefits of self-building and to make it a mainstream choice.

Housing costs are a person's biggest regular outgoing, either mortgage or rent.  Young people are finding it increasingly difficult or impossible to finance, they don’t know how they’re going to pay for a home in the future. BUT, job automation, means less money BUT more time.
Bringing self-building into the mainstream as a valid choice, saves many thousands of pounds in costs and interest payments.
The great Mark Twain said, “Buy land, they’re not making it anymore.”
Ones own home, built with love!!
Our expectation is that we can be a viable business in 2 years.

A woman said recently she was out of work but wanted to contribute.  I asked her if she could give £1, she said yes, but was it worth it? We agreed it was and she would ask her friends to put in £1. She promised to send £10, and she did. We really appreciate that she did this and kickstarted this campaign. Please know that we value and appreciate every gesture of support.
Sponsors for this project are aware that changes are needed in the housing market.
UK statistics show prior to CV19 that 180 people daily were being evicted from their home.
Every contribution brings us closer to supporting people to self-build secure homes, youngsters, parents and grandparents are a powerful group financially and energetically.
The cost of eco self-building is affordable, without excessive mortgage debt.
Our intention is to bring ecological self-building into the mainstream, giving people purpose and choice.
Our contributors will be celebrated, remembered and  known for their foresight and generosity.
Heroes are the pioneers of this new paradigm - the researchers, the developers, the contributors to life that works for everyone.
CONCLUSION ~Self and community building of sustainable eco-homes is perhaps the next bubble.
We promise to give information and trainings on how to build safe, long-lasting buildings in a community based on fellowship, humanity, teamwork, self-reliance and pride.

I’m imagining people with strong family values, philanthropists who are aware of social problems, and who are seeing a bigger picture.  They are adventurous, open to both old and new ideas for affordable, sustainable freehold, family housing, wanting old fashioned family values reinstated.
If we raise less than the full amount we will continue campaigning.
We'll prepare as much as possible during the pandemic, knowing we are preparing information and putting plans in place for those who want to learn more about self-building
My daughter said, ""When this is over, everyone will be running for the hills to self-build""
Please share our campaign to as many people as possible, giving them the choice to contribute and learn about eco self-building.
You could be opening a door for a friend or someone they know.
Were looking forward to sharing our progress with you and to seeing you in Portugal in the future.

Cosmos daisy is the portable air conditioner,heater and Dehumidifier with completely new and modern design.
» Air Conditioner
» Heater
» Dehumidifier
» Easy to use
» Super-quiet
» Designed for comfort
» Big 3000 BTU cooling and heating capacity

 

 

                                         

 

Anywhere you go take control of your comfort with the new, affordable and portable air conditioner and heater. Cosmos Daisy is  not an  evaporative cooler. Cosmos Daisy is real portable air conditioner, heater and dehumidifier with big 3000 BTU cooling and heating power. It’s compact and lightweight design makes Cosmos Daisy portable and can be used in RV’s, office, home, Indoors, outdoors, camping, tents, caravans, cottages and any other space which requires heating or cooling for perfect comfortable environment.

 

   

 

Can’t control heat or cool? It’s never the right temperature? Luckily with Cosmos Daisy you can maintain your personal environment to your liking. No more too hot or too cold.

 

 

   

 

Turn on heating or cooling with just a push of button. Cosmos Daisy ‘s advanced and smart control system maintains the right temperature and automatically control the fan speed to personalize your comfort. You can also manually adjust the fan speed according to your needs. It’s smart energy management system helps you save energy and let you take full control of your heating and cooling.

 

 

 

 

Cosmos Daisy is compact, lightweight and super portable. The thermoelectric cooling technology allows Cosmos Daisy to be lightweight and makes easy to take it anywhere you want. Experience maximum comfort with Cosmos Daisy exactly when you need it and where you need it.

 

 

 

 

Cosmos Daisy has everything you need. Big 3000 BTU cooling and heating power packed in a small box. Switch from heating to cooling or cooling to heating with just a push of button. No need to carry a separate heater. Cosmos Daisy takes care of all your needs with it's all in one design that packs heating, cooling and dehumidifier in one box.

 

 

 

 

All in one portable solution for all your cooling and heating needs. Cool or heat any space anytime and anywhere you want. Cosmos Daisy is small in size and can be used indoors or outdoors, RV’s, home, office, tents, camping, caravans, cottages etc. Now you have truly portable air conditioner and heater in one package.

column2: >              Any questions? Leave a comment or send us an email or check out FAQ's
column7:
> 

 

Cosmos Daisy uses thermoelectric cooling technology to heat or cool the air. Enjoy the big cooling and heating power (3000 BTU) of solid state devices and can cool or heat an area up to 150 sq. ft. It comes with 15 months’ warranty and completely maintenance free design.

Cosmos Daisy is small in size and this small footprint makes it easy to take the Cosmos Daisy anywhere you need it.

Cosmos Daisy has all the functions to maintain the perfect temperature anywhere you want. Cosmos Daisy is super quiet (55 db) and equipped with dehumidifier function to maintain the right humidity and provide maximum comfort. No condensate drain is needed for Cosmos Daisy as it uses the recycled condensate technology. It is completely drip and leak proof.

Cosmos Daisy can be run on any voltage available. You can run it on 12V DC directly or 110VAC/240VAC. It has built in power supply to convert 110V/240V AC to 12V DC.

 

 

In cooling mode, Cosmos Daisy simply cools the air by using solid state devices and exhaust the hot air out the back. Simply connect the exhaust duct included in the box to exhaust the hot air outside the space you are cooling. Air intake for both cold and hot side are located at the bottom. Make sure that your air intakes are not blocked while running the unit as it could result in overheating of solid state devices due to lack of airflow. You can control the fan speed by pushing ‘+’ and ‘-‘button according to your liking.

Cosmos Daisy doesn’t use heating coil. It heats the air by reversing the cycle of solid state devices. It reverses the cycle by changing the polarity of voltage. By reversing the cycle, it exhausts the cool air out the back and by using the exhaust duct you can exhaust the cool air to the outside.

For indoor or closed space use simply connect the duct and extend the other end outside.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You can order your unit by choosing the reward level on Indiegogo.

You will receive all the rewards that are listed under the reward level.

Shipping dates will be confirmed as soon as campaign ends.

Please make sure to check your email for updates or you can check updates on Indiegogo under updates tab.

All the information related to the order will be collected by email.

              Any questions? Leave a comment or send us an email or check out FAQ's

 

 

 

 

Cosmos Daisy is an innovative product designed by experienced engineers and designers after months of rigorous development. Cosmos Daisy has been in development for over a year and our team have addressed various technical hurdles to bring this product to life.

 Cosmos Daisy is designed and optimizes for comfort, easy to use and portability. Cosmos Daisy has 3000 BTU cooling and heating capacity and also comes with dehumidifier function to make your environment more comfortable and enjoyable. Heat and cool any environment to your liking and take control of your comfort with Cosmos Daisy.

FAQ’s

How can I power the unit?

  • You can power the unit with 12V DC, 110V AC or  240V AC. It has a built in power supply to convert 110V AC or 240V AC to 12VDC

How does it work?

  • It uses thermoelectric devices to heat and cool the air

Where can I use Cosmos Daisy?

  • Use it anywhere to cool or heat. Some examples – RV’s, office, home, camping, tent, caravans, cottages etc.

How can I control the heating and cooling?

  • You can control the heating and cooling by pressing ‘+’ button to increase the heating &

  • Yes, exhaust duct is included with the unit.

Is it an evaporative cooler?

  • No.

  • 3000 BTU or 150 sq. ft.

Does it need a condensate drain?

  • No, It uses recycled condensate technology where all the condensate produced flows to the hot side and evaporates due to high temperature.

  • 287.5mm*285mm*287.5mm

 

Is there any warranty on the unit?

  • Every unit includes 15 months’ warranty.
