Legion Solar is a simple do-it-yourself solar system with battery storage and off grid power with artificial intelligence (AI).

 

 

Solar energy is no longer an expensive complicated process. Install Legion Solar virtually anywhere.

Legion Solar is designed for anybody with any skill level to setup. It's that simple!   

 

 

 

Legion Solar works with your existing rate program to simply drive your consumption down. The result is simply a lowered electric bill.

 

 

 

We created SolarRegulator™, an artificial intelligence computer to contain generated energy behind your meter where the utility company does not own. Energy production of each Micro-Inverter is controlled so that energy production is less than or equal to energy consumption allowing you to generate your own electricity unrestricted.

 

 

Utility company only sees less consumption from you, not a grid tied solar system. As a result, it is not necessary to seek interconnection permission pertaining to utility company approved grid-tied solar systems.

 

 

We took all the short comings of traditional solar systems and designed a game changing new solution to outperform.

 

 

As you become familiar with Legion Solar, size up your system in stages. The larger the system, the more you'll offset and the more you'll save.
• Stage 1 - Get familiar with Legion Solar and it's components with the Starter Set. Sets up in minutes and experience instant results.
• Stage 2 - Scale your solar output with expansion sets to offset your daytime usage.
• Stage 3 - Once your system is large enough to have excess energy to store during daylight, add expansion sets with BatteryCommander™ for night time consumption.
• Stage 4 - Add Off Grid Controller™ and an Off Grid Inverter so that you have emergency power during grid power outages.

Bluetooth interface allows you to monitor your energy production and consumption, check system health, diagnostics and more via the LegionSolar App for Apple/Android. Try it for fee today. Search ""Legion Solar"" in iTunes or Google Play. 

 

 

Traditional solar systems have built-in costs such as resellers markups, installation labor, permits, sales reps, and other fees. Legion Solar is energy delivered straight to your door without the unnecessary costs giving you up to 3x faster ROI.

 

 

Legion Solar makes financial sense and outperforms nearly all other investments.

 

 

Legion Solar also outperforms nearly all other forms of energy in long term energy value. It makes clean energy PROFITABLE for you with ZERO emissions.
column6: >Deluxe Expansion Set + Lithium Battery
column8:
>Additional Accessories

 

To include Add-On items, tap the pink “Back It"" button that appears at the top of the page. Then add the above amount to your contribution. DO NOT select a perk and hit continue. For example, to add 4 expansion sets, multiply the above amount by 4 and add that to your pledge.

 

 

 

Backers and customers who currently own sets with Battery Commander 1, a FREE upgrade option is available to Battery Commander 2 with your pledge of the Deluxe Expansion Set or Deluxe Expansion Set with Lithium Battery up to the number of Battery Commander 1's that you currently own. For example, if you currently own 4 sets with Battery Commander 1 and you pledge for 5 Deluxe Expansion Sets, 4 Battery Commander 2 units will be included for FREE to upgrade your existing Battery Commander 1 to Battery Commander 2.

 

 

Legion Solar photovoltaic panels are 50% lighter and designed specifically for the Legion Solar Micro-Inverter to achieve an ideal system match for high efficiency DC to AC conversion. Rated for hurricane force winds, hail, and snow. High efficiency A Grade polycrystalline cells delivers unsurpassed price/watt performance with a 30 year service life.

 

 

Legion Solar micro-inverters are designed to achieve ideal system match for high efficiency DC to AC conversion. Up to 32 micro-inverters can be connected in a daisy-chain. Our micro-inverters employ maximum power point tracking (MPPT) technology to achieve maximum power output in full sun and partial shade conditions. LegionConnex™ wiring simplifies connectivity ideally suited for the do-it-yourself installer.

 

 

Micro-inverters outperform that of traditional central inverters due to no single point of failure. Each inverter cell works independently of each other to maximize energy production in partial cloud or shady conditions.

 

 

Legion Solar Lithium Iron Phosphate (LiFePO4) 25.6V 100Ah 2560Wh Deep Cycle batteries were carefully selected to be the ideal match for Battery Commander 2 in voltage, capacity, energy power density and weight optimized for do-it-yourself energy storage solutions. 

 

 

Lithium batteries are far superior to that of Lead Acid batteries in nearly every way. 

 

  • BatteryCommander 2 (New) connects in between the micro inverter and the solar panel. During daylight solar energy is used to supplement usage from your utility company and charge the batteries. At night, batteries supplement your usage enabling Legion Solar to completely offset all of your daytime and nighttime consumption. Compatible with Lithium Iron Phosphate (LiFePO4) and standard Sealed Lead Acid Batteries , two deep cycle 12V batteries or connected in series or one 24V battery with capacity range 60-120Ah is recommended for each BatteryCommander branch.

 

  •  OffGrid Controller is a combiner hub for your batteries to multiply usable capacity. It detects when grid power goes down and automatically turns on power to the backup inverter to supply power to an off grid branch circuit where you can power all of your basic necessities in any emergency. When power goes out, lights and appliances connected to this branch automatically turn on. When power comes back, the emergency branch circuit automatically turns off. Compatible with both Lithium and Lead Acid battery chemistries.

 

  •  Off Grid Inverter is used to supply grid compatible AC power from 24V batteries for use with appliances rated up to 3000 Watts. Have peace of mind for you and your family in any emergency.
column9: >Tap to see manuals and more how to videos and demonstrations.
column11:
>

  • Battery Commander 1 has been upgraded to Battery Commander 2 now with support for Lithium Iron Phosphate (LiFePO4) 24V battery, and improved charging efficiency for Flooded/Sealed Lead Acid Batteries.

 

  • Solar Regulator 2.0 has been upgraded to Solar Regulator 3.0 now with hardware support for 3 phase systems for commercial buildings.

 

  • Solar Regulator's Artificial Intelligence (AI) 2.0 has been upgraded to AI 3.0 with improved power production algorithms and monitoring efficiency. Support and optimization for Lithium Iron Phosphate (LiFePO4) batteries and 3 phase utility power.

 

  • Legion Solar App will have more advanced diagnostics for troubleshooting, and system maintenance functions.

 

Legion Solar 5 is 100% compatible with Legion Solar 3 and 4 components. Legion Solar 3 and 4 owners will automatically get the benefits of AI 3.0 via automatic software updates.

We have raised over $3.2 Million on crowd funding platforms and fulfilled rewards to 27,000+ backers since 2013. Innovation is our passion and we hope that you enjoyed our projects as much as we enjoyed creating them.

 

 

The prolific use of fossil fuels has resulted in the rise of our planet’s carbon dioxide levels not seen in over 5 millions years (before the time of humans).

The technology for complete transition to clean energy is possible now. With your support we can take control and choose to offset our dependence of harmful fossil fuels. It's our responsibility to leave our planet in better condition for our future generations than we found it. Join the fight for clean energy and become a Legion Today!

Bypass all regulations"" pertains to regulations associated with grid tied utility approved solar systems.",53.0,7,"3 Campaigns
Bodie Cavanagh runs Dovetail Timbers, a timber salvage
column2: /> business that makes dovetail cabins, garden beds and chook houses from salvaged wood.

column1: Christina Giudici runs FIMBY, a gardening business that helps people grow their own food. Bodie and Christina have
column2: />been friends and collaborators since they each started their businesses in Southern Tasmania around nine years ago.

column1: This project grew out of Christina's interest in making and using biochar, and Bodie's interest in pushing his business to be ever more sustainable.

Through conversations and shared enthusiasm, Bodie and Christina realised that perhaps they could combine these interests, by building a device that takes waste from Bodie's business, and produces biochar for use in gardening, soil and water management, effluent management, and many other uses.

A key player that enabled this project to become a reality is James Fox, a semi-retired process and chemical engineer with years of experience building coffee roasters, sawdust kilns, and biodiesel plants. James knows Bodie's business well, and understands pyrolysis, gasification and the intricacies of fabricating a machine to make this work. With Bodie and James's mechanical and process engineering heads together, they have designed a kiln that can use the sawdust and chipped offcuts from Bodie's Dovetail operation, capture the heat and gases for energy and drying timber, and produce biochar of reliable quality.

Christina already makes and uses biochar with her gardening clients, sharing the process of how to make biochar in an earth pit kiln at very little cost, other than time to collect materials and manage the burn. We love the simplicity of this process, and applaud and support the many people who are using open kilns to produce biochar for themselves and others.

But the opportunity of harnessing the waste wood at Bodie's operation can only be fully realised with a more industrial approach. Hence this project which automates and contains the pyrolysis reaction.

Biochar is a type of charcoal, but not the same sort that you’d use to cook a BBQ steak. Technically speaking, biochar is pyrolyzed organic material intended to be applied to soil for gardening or farming, or fed to animals.
It can also be used in building materials, insulation, absorption of pollutants, filtration, energy storage in batteries, and other industrial processes.

Because of the huge surface area of biochar at a microscopic level, it is very good at absorbing air, water and soluble plant nutrients, like a sponge. In poor sandy soils this can be a big help in preventing valuable nutrients from being washed through the soil and lost below the root zone.

Biochar also acts like an electro-chemical sponge, and can adsorb and hold onto charged nutrients (eg cations like sulphate and phosphate), which again is helpful in poor soils with a low cation exchange capacity.

The porous stable structure of biochar also provides habitat for soil organisms, bacteria and fungi, which are essential for healthy soil and release of nutrients from decaying organic matter. The carbon structures in biochar are very long lived, and wont break down in decades or even centuries.

Biochar is not a fertiliser on its own. It can help make best use of any fertiliser that you apply to the soil. Trials conducted in Tasmania and all over the world have shown positive results in yield and quality of fruit and vegies from adding it to soil. Some trials have shown negative results too. If you add raw, fresh biochar to the soil that hasn’t been “charged” with nutrients, there can be negative effects in the short term, as the biochar binds with nutrients it finds in the soil and can make them unavailable to plants.

In trials with Christina's FIMBY clients in Tasmania, using biochar has proven beneficial in promoting plant growth and soil health in poor soils, most likely through holding water and nutrients. The prospect of being able to access plentiful biochar at a reasonable cost is exciting, as this will make it accessible for people without the time or unloved biomass resources to make their own at the scale they would like.

There are many opportunities for biochar to be a valuable part of solutions to complex waste / nutrient problems, and this project can make enough biochar available for these applications to be realistically explored in Tasmania.

If we are able to engage the help we need to fabricate and put the kiln together, we can prove the concept of this mid-level technology approach. We hope that others will do the same in other places, and are happy to share what we learn as we continue on this journey.
We've already put in all the design work for this sophisticated beast. We need $50,000 more to bring it to reality. Our budget is broken up like this:
$22,000 for materials (bits of machinery, engines, re-purposed parts of other industrial plant)
$18,000 for fabrication of metal components that don't exist already in some form
$10,000 for installing and commissioning the kiln on site, and tinkering so that it works.

If we exceed our target, we can upscale our design, make more biochar, and sequester more carbon, of course. We will also put any additional funds into testing and certification, refine the design to extract more valuable products, eg wood vinegar, and research ways to use biochar to help solve some tricky problems. For example in Tassie we have some high nutrient effluent that is currently causing environmental damage. This could become an assett with the right application of biochar and intelligence.

If we don't reach our target, we'll build something - the minimum ""junk-engineered"" version that we need to be able to produce biochar. It probably wont be automated, nor quite as clever, but it will allow us to get started towards what we really have in mind.

To entice you to contribute, we have some delicious perks! For Tassie people, you can of course get yourself some lovely biochar for your garden or animal systems. We can make it straight and clean, or nutrient enriched, depending on your needs. You can also book us for a workshop / demonstration at your place to show you how to make your own biochar, low-tech style, and how best to use it in your compost, garden, or chook system.

If you're a gardener keen to save your back, or have a sunny courtyard that you'd love to make more productive, we're offering Bodie's gorgeous Dovetail Timber garden beds, which can be delivered to you where-ever you are. These will include a wicking bed kit, to save water and boost productivity.
If you're keen to talk to the engineers about the biochar kiln design and build, we're offering coaching sessions, in person or by skype, so that you can get going on your own version.

There's plenty more on offer: garden consultations, seasonal gardening calendars, beautiful garden-y artwork, beeswax wraps, and more. Or if you have a brilliant idea for a perk that you'd love to see, get in touch!
You can can use your credit card to ‘Pay as a Guest’ in PayPal without signing in.

Everybody loves a good closed loop system, where the outputs from one element are the inputs for another. That's what we're trying to do here, with the end game being to sequester carbon in the soil for the long term.

The system that we're designing for is a sawmilling / wood manufacturing business, that uses salvaged and low quality logs as its input. We take the waste from that process, and stabilise the carbon into biochar, capturing the heat energy and gases as we go. The carbon, as biochar, after various cascading uses, will end up in soil, rather than as CO2 from eventual decomposition of the sawdust and offcuts. Using forests to create biochar does not necessarily result in net carbon sequestration. But using a waste product from a process that itself uses salvaged materials - that's a win.

If you're tempted to hit that ""offset your carbon"" button when you book flights, we're offering an alternative way to offset your carbon footprint. You're contribution will be helping set up something that will keep evolving, and keep adding value while it sequesters carbon long term.

This project is has its challenges. We have a design, but will it really work in the way that we imagine? We're pretty confident that it will, based on all of James and Bodie's experience and deep understanding of managing temperature, oxygen levels, duration and flow in a pyrolysis system. But we are not exactly copying an existing model, even though there are many and varied gasifiers and pyrolysis units out there. It might require some tinkering to get it running smoothly. So we've allowed plenty of time in our schedule for that.

We're also aiming to eventually have our biochar certified under the European Biochar Certificate (EBC). We've designed the process to tick all the boxes, but we wont know for certain till we produce some outputs and get them sampled and tested if we will meet the key criteria for the EBC. These are:
Feedstock: organic waste, non toxic, from sustainable sources, small distances for transport. Yep, big time!
Production method: managing fluctuation in temperature during pyrolysis, no fossil fuels used in pyrolysis, gases trapped or cleanly burned, heat used or recycled. Absolutely!

Properties of the biochar: carbon content, nutrient content, heavy metal content threshold, volatile organic compound quantity, pH, bulk density, ash content, polyaromatic hydrocarbons and so on must meet certain criteria. We reckon so, will need to confirm by testing.
Handling and use: fire and dust suppression plans, transport at known moisture content, health and safety warnings and information. Yes, all is planned for this.
We will be working hard to manage all the parameters so that we can proudly say we're certified to a high standard.

We know that not everyone is in a position to contribute dollars. Even if you're not able to grab yourself one of the lovely perks that come with a cash contribution, we'd ask you to SHARE SHARE SHARE! If what we're trying to do appeals to you, it would help enormously if you'd spread the word among your networks, and tell people why you're keen to see this happen.
Thanks for reading all the way to the bottom!
","Bodie Cavanagh runs Dovetail Timbers, a timber salvage business that makes dovetail cabins, garden beds and chook houses from salvaged wood.

Christina Giudici runs FIMBY, a gardening business that helps people grow their own food. Bodie and Christina have been friends and collaborators since they each started their businesses in Southern Tasmania around nine years ago.
This project grew out of Christina's interest in making and using biochar, and Bodie's interest in pushing his business to be ever more sustainable.

Through conversations and shared enthusiasm, Bodie and Christina realised that perhaps they could combine these interests, by building a device that takes waste from Bodie's business, and produces biochar for use in gardening, soil and water management, effluent management, and many other uses.

A key player that enabled this project to become a reality is James Fox, a semi-retired process and chemical engineer with years of experience building coffee roasters, sawdust kilns, and biodiesel plants. James knows Bodie's business well, and understands pyrolysis, gasification and the intricacies of fabricating a machine to make this work. With Bodie and James's mechanical and process engineering heads together, they have designed a kiln that can use the sawdust and chipped offcuts from Bodie's Dovetail operation, capture the heat and gases for energy and drying timber, and produce biochar of reliable quality.

Christina already makes and uses biochar with her gardening clients, sharing the process of how to make biochar in an earth pit kiln at very little cost, other than time to collect materials and manage the burn. We love the simplicity of this process, and applaud and support the many people who are using open kilns to produce biochar for themselves and others.

But the opportunity of harnessing the waste wood at Bodie's operation can only be fully realised with a more industrial approach. Hence this project which automates and contains the pyrolysis reaction.

Biochar is a type of charcoal, but not the same sort that you’d use to cook a BBQ steak. Technically speaking, biochar is pyrolyzed organic material intended to be applied to soil for gardening or farming, or fed to animals.
It can also be used in building materials, insulation, absorption of pollutants, filtration, energy storage in batteries, and other industrial processes.

Because of the huge surface area of biochar at a microscopic level, it is very good at absorbing air, water and soluble plant nutrients, like a sponge. In poor sandy soils this can be a big help in preventing valuable nutrients from being washed through the soil and lost below the root zone.

Biochar also acts like an electro-chemical sponge, and can adsorb and hold onto charged nutrients (eg cations like sulphate and phosphate), which again is helpful in poor soils with a low cation exchange capacity.

The porous stable structure of biochar also provides habitat for soil organisms, bacteria and fungi, which are essential for healthy soil and release of nutrients from decaying organic matter. The carbon structures in biochar are very long lived, and wont break down in decades or even centuries.

Biochar is not a fertiliser on its own. It can help make best use of any fertiliser that you apply to the soil. Trials conducted in Tasmania and all over the world have shown positive results in yield and quality of fruit and vegies from adding it to soil. Some trials have shown negative results too. If you add raw, fresh biochar to the soil that hasn’t been “charged” with nutrients, there can be negative effects in the short term, as the biochar binds with nutrients it finds in the soil and can make them unavailable to plants.

In trials with Christina's FIMBY clients in Tasmania, using biochar has proven beneficial in promoting plant growth and soil health in poor soils, most likely through holding water and nutrients. The prospect of being able to access plentiful biochar at a reasonable cost is exciting, as this will make it accessible for people without the time or unloved biomass resources to make their own at the scale they would like.

There are many opportunities for biochar to be a valuable part of solutions to complex waste / nutrient problems, and this project can make enough biochar available for these applications to be realistically explored in Tasmania.

If we are able to engage the help we need to fabricate and put the kiln together, we can prove the concept of this mid-level technology approach. We hope that others will do the same in other places, and are happy to share what we learn as we continue on this journey.
What We Need & What You Get
We've already put in all the design work for this sophisticated beast. We need $50,000 more to bring it to reality. Our budget is broken up like this:
$22,000 for materials (bits of machinery, engines, re-purposed parts of other industrial plant)
$18,000 for fabrication of metal components that don't exist already in some form
$10,000 for installing and commissioning the kiln on site, and tinkering so that it works.

If we exceed our target, we can upscale our design, make more biochar, and sequester more carbon, of course. We will also put any additional funds into testing and certification, refine the design to extract more valuable products, eg wood vinegar, and research ways to use biochar to help solve some tricky problems. For example in Tassie we have some high nutrient effluent that is currently causing environmental damage. This could become an assett with the right application of biochar and intelligence.

If we don't reach our target, we'll build something - the minimum ""junk-engineered"" version that we need to be able to produce biochar. It probably wont be automated, nor quite as clever, but it will allow us to get started towards what we really have in mind.

To entice you to contribute, we have some delicious perks! For Tassie people, you can of course get yourself some lovely biochar for your garden or animal systems. We can make it straight and clean, or nutrient enriched, depending on your needs. You can also book us for a workshop / demonstration at your place to show you how to make your own biochar, low-tech style, and how best to use it in your compost, garden, or chook system.

If you're a gardener keen to save your back, or have a sunny courtyard that you'd love to make more productive, we're offering Bodie's gorgeous Dovetail Timber garden beds, which can be delivered to you where-ever you are. These will include a wicking bed kit, to save water and boost productivity.
If you're keen to talk to the engineers about the biochar kiln design and build, we're offering coaching sessions, in person or by skype, so that you can get going on your own version.

There's plenty more on offer: garden consultations, seasonal gardening calendars, beautiful garden-y artwork, beeswax wraps, and more. Or if you have a brilliant idea for a perk that you'd love to see, get in touch!
You can can use your credit card to ‘Pay as a Guest’ in PayPal without signing in.

Hi, I'm Jonathan from PureSelfMade!

In this book you will learn how to build a small wind turbine and use it to make your own electricity. It will be available in English &
column2:
German language.
This is a collaborative project between me and Hugh Piggott.

As an enthusiast for renewable energy and do-it-yourself solutions I teach practical workshops with my organization PureSelfMade, where people learn how to build small wind turbines and other renewable energy equipment. 

From simple materials and with litte skills needed. These turbines can be used to generate electricity, for example in off grid systems and for rural electrification.

For my projects I choose the reliable Piggott Wind Turbine Design, developed by my friend Hugh Piggott in the windy north of Scotland. This design is efficient, robust and cost effective for locally built wind turbines. Over the years this design has advanced in many ways, for example, the new Ferrite generator concepts where developed, based on the original Piggott design.

After building about 30 Wind Turbines in my workshops and collecting a lot of Ideas, it is now time to turn them into a new publication and share the knowledge.

What you get:

This book will contain the latest plans for building the Ferrite Generator Wind Turbines, also called „the F-Series“ originally engineered by Hugh Piggott, wich covers designs from 600W to about 3kW rated power.

The book is intended to give you all the essential information you need to get straight into wind turbine building and create an independent off grid system, using a simple and practical approach and open source solutions wherever possible.

The book will include:

column1: • Detailed step-by-step instruction for the whole building process
• Plans for building your tower to carry the wind turbine
• A system design section on how to combine your turbine with solar panels and battery storage to make the best use of your homemade electricity.
• General information about small wind turbine design, use and maintenance.

How to support us

For your appreciated support you will get your copy of the book once it has been finished and printed. You can also choose from other perks, for example your place in a Wind Turbine hands-on building workshop!

Insights

The book will be self-published by PureSelfMade. In this campaign we want to raise the money for completing the book and printing the first round of copies. 

The concept for the book is finished. Currently the book is being written and illustrated - which is still a lot of work for a proper technical do-it-yourself manual.

The collected funds will only go into this specific project and pay for layout, design, printing, shipping copies to the supporters and other expenses associated with the making and distribution of the book. The margin per copy that is left after all expenses have been paid will go to the authors (Jonathan Schreiber &
column2:
Hugh Piggott) in return of the countless hours they dedicated to the project.

Project Timeline

column1:
Although we are giving our best to finish this project on time (and our schedule seems realistic), the release date is an estimate and can not be guaranteed  Anyway, we will keep you posted about the progress!

Please note that the final cover design of the book may vary, as it has not been fully developed yet.

Workshop &
column2:
Windturbine Perks

(Only in Austria or Germany)

If you choose one of these, Wow! Thank you for your support, that means a lot to us!
We will contact you to arrange your participation in one of our hands on wind turbine workshops.
These courses take place regularly in Austria and Germany. You can check the next Workshop dates on PureSelfMade.com. You can choose to participate in a Workshop prior to the book release. The Workshop Place Perk covers the course fee of the practical hands-on workshop. The cost for on-site accommodation and meals during the workshop is not included and will be managed on demand as it may vary with the participant's personal preferences.

If you choose to take the Workshop &
column3:
Wind Turbine perk, you can take the turbine built in the workshop with you afterwards. This will be a 2F Piggott Turbine built from the book's design. It brings up to 600W rated output in around 12m/s windspeed. Suitable for off-grid or grid connected systems. Bear in mind that the turbine is built in a course situation and therefore no warranties or refund can be given.

Superior to hand dryers used in public areas, Nyuair gives you a brand new hand drying experience when you’re at home. It delivers you Super Hygienic Air with its unique air-duct design and the washable High-Density filter inside. Farewell to endless costs on paper towels, Nyuair is a must-have for those who want to protect the environment and save money as well. It’s the best partner for your wallet and the planet.
According to the survey statistics, over 80% of unused paper towels are polluted by bacteria in the air regardless of the transport method. Think about towels
column2:
that’s even more terrible! Ditch all the dirty towels now! You only need one Nyuair to truly clean and dry your hands with filtered and heated airflow. No touching with something, no more worry about Cross-Contamination!

 

 

With the size of 8.1’’*5.7’’*4.0’’,Nyuair fits all the compact spaces in your house like the wall next to the kitchen sink or the washbasin in the bathroom.
column3:
>Choose the one that best fits your interior decorating style

The coolest thing is that the panel on Nyuair is magnetic, you can easily take it off and put it back with a click. The stylish design allows you to change another panel with a personalized pattern.

 

 

 

With a Hollow Design and an Ultra High-Efficiency Motor inside, the internal air-duct of Nyuair shows its efficiency to make the outlet airflow reach twice the intake. Nyuair draws up to 4.5 gallons of air per second, equivalent to the capacity of 18 glass bottles of Coca-Cola. Powered by this high-efficiency motor, Nyuair delivers you the mightiest airflow and quickly removes the water on your hands.

 

 

 

The air-duct of Nyuair will always be clean with the Built-in UV lamp. The UV lamp will turn on automatically 5 seconds after each hands-drying. And the high-density filter screen guarantees the hygiene of the internal structure which filters out 99.9% of dust and impurities. Nyuair is absolutely your green life essential item.

When you put your wet hands under Nyuair, the Touchless Sensor will automatically start the drying. Being low in noise and having no harshness, Nyuair will not bother anyone else in your house or terrify your children and pets. Every member of your family can enjoy the 104℉/40℃ constant temperature and quickly dry their hands.

Perfectly built for home and personal use, Nyuair is super easy to install on the wall or stand on the countertop. To mount on the wall, you only need to stick the liquid nails backing on the wall for a Drill-Free Installation. You can also choose screws to get more permanent. Everything will be ready in the box. Moreover, you can add an extra bracket for flexible standing which can be quickly installed within 5 secs.

The Nyuair adapter comes with US Pins. If the US prong is not for you, you can choose one of the converters(AU/EU/UK) based on your need, and it’s free! Survey will be sent out to ask for your option for plugs after the campaign ends.

Nyuair is designed for compact areas like your kitchen and bathroom, but it can also meet commercial requirements such as offices, hotels, gyms, hospitals, restaurants, schools...You can put Nyuair anywhere you want to perfectly clean and dry your hands.
column4:
>Nyuair Offers 1 Year Worry-Free Replacement Warranty for Our Backers.

 

 

 

Nowadays more and more people realize the importance of environmental protection. Nyuair Team also considered the significance of this hand dryer for environmental protection. Household appliances should not only be luxurious, beautiful, and trendy. We hope that we can reduce the use of paper towels and produce lower energy consumption and lower carbon emissions without reducing performance through our products. And years of practice have also proven that our world has begun to become greener, and we are truly happy and proud of it. We introduce this product to you and thank you for your dedication to the beauty of the earth. 

Established in 2018, Nyuair Team owns a number of experienced engineers and designers who are committed to researching and developing home appliances that bring a new sense of experience to people. Nyuair’s business integrates R&
column5:
D, production, and marketing. Our current products include hand dryers, hairdryers, and electric toothbrushes. Nyuair Team continues to innovate categories and believes that innovation can change the dimension of life. We will continue to bring people a cleaner life and a better experience.

Test Video

SolarGaps | Photovoltaic Solar Panel Window Blinds

Reduce your apartment, home and/or business electricity bill by up to 70% with solar energy generating smart blinds.
column2: >

column3: '>We engineered SolarGaps with features designed for renters, homeowners and businesses to affordably reduce energy usage, create renewable energy and make the transition to energy independence:

column2: PLAY - With apartment renters in mind, the interior wall brackets are designed as a non-permanent, plug &
column3: play solution with additional installation options for homeowners to maximize energy production.

column1: ENERGY GENERATING - Built-in solar panels can generate up to 100W-150W of renewable energy per 10 sq. ft. (≈ 1 m2) of a window, enough to power 30 LED light bulbs or three MacBooks.
ENERGY REDUCING - In addition to generating solar energy, the window blinds also save energy by shading your home interior and reducing air condition cost by up to 80%.
AFFORDABLE - Energy surplus can either be stored in the battery or can easily be sold to your electricity company as green energy through a two-way meter they provide.
SMART FEATURES - Easily integrate with smart devices like Google Home, Echo, Nest Thermostat and more to control by voice, temperature and/or smartphone app.

column2: >
column4:
>

 

The obvious solution for those who can't (renters) or don't want to install expensive rooftop solar panels.

column14:
>

 

They're designed to look like traditional window blinds but they're smart and covered with photovoltaic modules.
column15: >

column1:
SolarGaps are the world’s first renewable energy producing window blinds that use solar panels to create electricity to power your apartment, home or office.

By replacing your current window treatments with solar energy producing window blinds, you can save up to 70% on your electric power bill allowing the SolarGaps to essentially pay for themselves over time.
column2:
>

Yevgen Erik (founder) was in charge of building eco-friendly houses and installing blinds in office buildings when the idea of solar blinds came to him.

column1: ""I spent one day in the fields outside of the city studying how the sunflowers followed the sun...then, I carried out research which proved that although solar modules are the cheapest among all other sources of energy, they are the most effective ones"" ~ Yevgen Erik
After researching the sun-tracking characteristics of the sunflower plant, Yevgen then experimented with ways to replicate the self-adjusting movements automatically in his blinds.
column3:
>

Not sure what option is right for you? Check out these tables.

The photovoltaic cells generate electricity to power devices, store in a battery and/or sell to your electricity company.
column4:
>Outer facing photovoltaic solar panel cells

Photovoltaic systems produce the most power during the day when the demand and price for electricity is higher. 

Once installed over a window (inside or outside), the smart blinds with built-in solar panels can generate up to 100W of energy per 10 sq. ft. (≈ 1 m2) of a window, which is enough to power 30 LED light bulbs or three MacBooks.

  • For example, a three-room apartment with four windows of 2 sq.m. (about 20 sq. ft.) each facing south may be able to produce on average 7 kWh a day / 210 kWh a month assuming average daylight of 8.5 hours a day. In an office or retail space you can generate up to 10 times more. 

 

Will you consume, store, or sell your power?

 

Any energy surplus that's generated can either be stored in a battery or sold to the utility grid allowing you to take advantage of peak loads and daily fluctuations in electricity usage.

column1: Consume Energy - The included SolarGaps dock that allows you to charge and power devices within your home or office.
Battery Storage - By storing surplus energy in a battery, you can reduce your energy bill by consuming stored energy during peak hours when rates are higher.
Sell To Grid - With a two-way meter from your utility company, you can sell your surplus energy by supplying it to the power grid during the day when the demand and price is higher.

column6:
Self-Adjusting

To absorb as much solar energy as possible, SolarGaps automatically adjusts the angle of the panels to follow the sun’s position.

column3: '>You can setup SolarGaps to match your own schedule and needs. For example, the blinds can be setup to open automatically when you want to wake up, or close at a predetermined time.

column1: • SolarGaps can even open automatically when someone enters a room to keep your house bright inside.

iOS and Android App

Open and close your blinds remotely from anywhere in the world allowing you to ensure privacy, protect from weather and/or create automations.

column3: '>With the internet connected app, SolarGaps can utilize information such as weather forecast to generate energy more efficiently.

column1: • SolarGaps connects to our app via WiFi or Bluetooth allowing for basic controls to raise or lower the blinds, change the angle, and display how much energy is being generated.

Internet of Things

With the SolarGaps app you can integrate directly with Google Home to enable voice controlled commands to open, close, etc.

•  SolarGaps integrates with Google Home and Amazon Echo to enable voice controlled commands, as well as Nest Thermostat to allow your blinds to adjust lighting to heat or cool your home naturally.

column1: Simply mount SolarGaps on the wall over your window using the brackets provided or install them on the outside of your home.

column2:
>

Then plug SolarGaps into a power outlet and lower your energy bills by feeding electricity back to the grid. Any energy surplus can either be stored in batteries or be sold to your power utility.

column1: DIY installation - You can install SolarBlinds yourself by following our simple instructions. Just mount SolarGaps on the wall over your window using the brackets provided. We recommend you install SolarGaps outside for better efficiency (up to 100-150 Wh in an hour per 10 sq. ft.). When installed inside, the amount of power generation is reduced.

Durable - The outer shell of SolarGaps is made out of a very strong and durable aluminum. Tested with an air gun, SolarGaps is unmatched on the market today when it comes to protecting your windows from poor weather conditions (e.g. storms, etc.). Built for all climates, SolarGaps can operate perfectly in the wide range of temperatures – between -40 and + 176 degrees Fahrenheit (-40 and +80 degrees Celsius). SolarGaps uses durable, high quality solar cells, best value on the market today.

Custom - designed to fit a broad range of windows. We have a variety of sizes ranging from Extra Small to Extra Large. If you're interested in custom sizing, send us a message! We're here to cater to your specific needs.

column1: The hard part is complete, we just need your support.
It started with a passion for green energy.

The idea of combining solar panels and motorized blinds was born when the SolarGaps founder, Yevgen Erik, was in charge of building eco-friendly houses and installing blinds in office buildings during the many years he worked in the construction industry.

column2: >

column1: This idea consumed Yevgen so much that he spent a day in the fields outside the city studying how sunflowers follow the sun. He then carried out research about solar power which proved that modern solar panels, while being the most efficient among alternative power sources, are also the cheapest. This brought him to the conclusion that the best time to launch SolarGaps is now.

Today billions of city residents never have the opportunity to use solar power because they live in apartments with no roof access to install solar panels. Yet, the majority of them have windows which can be used to generate electricity and save energy. SolarGaps provides them with such an opportunity.

No matter if you live in a house or an apartment, SolarGaps opens your windows (pun intended) to green energy. With this distributed approach to power generation, we can fight global warming and fulfill the dream of many -- to live comfortably and be energy independent anywhere.

With SolarGaps, we can create a point-to-point electrical network, since personal power generation can be available to billions of people. Some people might prefer to store the electricity produced by SolarGaps using batteries like Tesla’s Powerwall and sell electricity to others at night.
SolarGaps is the brainchild of a team led by Yevgen Erik, a Ukrainian inventor who is passionate about green energy.
","SolarGaps | Photovoltaic Solar Panel Window BlindsReduce your apartment, home and/or business electricity bill by up to 70% with solar energy generating smart blinds.
We engineered SolarGaps with features designed for renters, homeowners and businesses to affordably reduce energy usage, create renewable energy and make the transition to energy independence:

DIY PLUG & PLAY - With apartment renters in mind, the interior wall brackets are designed as a non-permanent, plug & play solution with additional installation options for homeowners to maximize energy production.
ENERGY GENERATING - Built-in solar panels can generate up to 100W-150W of renewable energy per 10 sq. ft. (≈ 1 m2) of a window, enough to power 30 LED light bulbs or three MacBooks.
ENERGY REDUCING - In addition to generating solar energy, the window blinds also save energy by shading your home interior and reducing air condition cost by up to 80%.
AFFORDABLE - Energy surplus can either be stored in the battery or can easily be sold to your electricity company as green energy through a two-way meter they provide.
SMART FEATURES - Easily integrate with smart devices like Google Home, Echo, Nest Thermostat and more to control by voice, temperature and/or smartphone app.

The obvious solution for those who can't (renters) or don't want to install expensive rooftop solar panels.Check out the 30 second video above to see a quick overview of how SolarGaps works.  Have a look at some recent press and media reviews of the SolarGaps smart window shades:    ""One of those ideas that seems so obvious after you hear about it, because even 'dumb' window blinds can save a significant amount of energy"" -TREEHUGGER ""Solargaps have created their smart solar blinds to open the window to green energy for anyone and everyone"" - DESIGNBOOM ""If you are looking for relief from the heat and from a high electricity bill, this may just be the product for you"" - DIGITAL TRENDS ""SolarGaps actually has a shippable product ready with only a few differences from the final product they are promising if the campaign is successful"" - ANDROID AND ME ""On display here at Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, SolarGaps turns the actual slats of your window coverings into solar panels"" - CNET""Your windows become powerful with SolarGaps."" - Techcrunch     They're designed to look like traditional window blinds but they're smart and covered with photovoltaic modules.

Product introduced to customers at CES
It started with a passion for green energy.

SolarGaps is the brainchild of a team led by Yevgen Erik, a Ukrainian inventor who is passionate about green energy.",35.0,4,"1 Campaign

We started Green Path Technology to design and produce innovative products for the residential Solar market. After spending several years selling, designing and installing conventional PV systems, panels and micro inverters on the roof, we identified opportunities for system and process improvements. Namely: cost, form factor and efficiency improvements were identified as ways to improve the systems available to homeowners and renters alike.

My background is engineering. I have a master’s degree in electrical engineering and over 20 years of product design experience. My partner and wife has a degree in accounting and has well over 20 years of experience in sales and marketing. We both felt compelled to try to make improvements to PV systems with respect to the homeowner's needs. The Joule Power Tree is the result of over 3 years of development and testing the mechanical and electrical systems that make up the whole Joule Renewable System . We are proud and excited to launch this Indiegogo campaign to get started with the production of the Joule Power Tree and get it into service with homeowners and renters all over the world.

The funding that we receive from our backers in exchange for the perks will be used to purchase capital equipment, rent a production facility and to hire a manufacturing team. Some of the capital equipment needed includes equipment associated with the assembly and testing of solar products such as encapsulation and lamination equipment and PV panel power output testers. We also use FMD (3D) printers to produce a number of the components of the Joule Power Tree so we’ll need to acquire several more FDM printers for the production of the Tree.
To show our appreciation to the backers for supporting us, we are offering Joule Power Tree perks. We will offer 4 different models of the Tree with different features:

1. Production processes risks. The biggest risk to the timely delivery of the perks, the Joule Power Tree, to our backers is the development and success of a production process to produce the many components of the tree. Just as a real tree has many, many leaves, the Joule Power Tree has many, many solar cell leaves. While we have successfully produced many leaves to date and have contracted manufacturing from outside of our company to mass produce the leaves, the challenge still remains to produce the leaves in great quantity, with high quality and at a cost that will keep us competitive. We are qualified to overcome this particular challenge because of our strong ties to companies in the manufacturing industry specific to PCB and PCB assembly. We have already approached several build-to-print manufacturers to provide us with quotations and methods of manufacturing that look extremely favorable and promising, but not yet proven.

• Materials acquisition risks. The second biggest risk to timely delivery of the product is the risk associated with the procurement of the materials needed to produce the Joule Power Tree with short lead-times and at a price that will keep the cost of the Joule Power Tree low. The Joule Power Tree units that have been produced to date use components that were purchased from vendors that stock the items and offer the value-add to their customers of timely deliver, but at a substantial cost. We need to seek out vendors that will deliver quickly and allow us to take advantages of cost savings realized by economies of scale. While this is a challenge, we are qualified to solve this problem also by use of our network of manufacturing partners. We intend to leverage our relationships fostered over the years with manufacturing companies and their procurement departments to help us find vendors that can and will deliver the materials necessary for the mass production of the Joule Power Tree.

• Manufacturing Team Assembly Risks. The third and final risk to the delivery of the perks to our backers is the risk of finding good help. It will take time to spin-up a work force to build the Joule Power Tree once the production processes are in place. We will again rely on our network of manufacturers to assist us with this effort. We have made plans to seek out the facility in a familiar city and where we know many capable and willing workers to get this activity off the ground.

If you are as passionate as we are about “GOING GREEN,” but cannot be a backer at this time, please share the campaign info and the many social media links with your family, friends, and networks to help us get the word out. Please like, share, and subscribe to our posts (www.JoulePowerTree.com) . This is a HUGE help to us and is GREATLY appreciated. Thank you very much.

How does it work? The Solar Cow – one of Time Magazine’s 100 Best Inventions of 2019 – is a solar charging system installed in schools in rural off-grid regions of Africa. Solar Cow allows children to charge portable batteries, called Solar Milk, while they attend class and take them home at the end of the school day. It becomes a valuable source of energy for charging cell phones and lighting their home at night.

Many low-income families rely on kerosene lighting and relatively expensive charging stations to meet their energy needs. The electricity budget of the average Kenyan household takes up to 15% of their monthly income, so saving money on electricity is a great benefit. The green energy from Solar Cow is a tangible incentive for parents to send their children to school instead of work.

 

Meeting the families’ short-term energy needs also helps them break the cycle of poverty on the long run by providing education to children, creating fundamental changes in their lives. Education enables people to improve their own lives without having to rely on external assistance.  

YOLK developed a custom charging socket that is only compatible with the Solar Cow charging systems so that parents must send kids to school in order to charge their batteries. This also helps to prevent misallocation or theft. For our Indiegogo backers, we will send Solar Milks that can be charged through a regular USB-C so you can use it at home.

Our projects in Kenya and Tanzania proved so effective in increasing attendance rates, it was almost as though the children were brought to school by magic!

 

What’s more, backers who select the Give + Data option can access the attendance data of the child who received a Solar Milk from them. Each battery given to the children in Africa has a unique ID code, which the Solar Cow records every time it is being charged. This allows supporters to see the real impact of their purchase for a better world.
column3:
showinfo=0"">

With the funding from Indiegogo, we will be able to launch this very new project concept to track the impact of Solar Milks and Solar Cows. Delivering real individual data of users in Africa directly to our backers is something that no other project has tried before.

 

Solar Milk is a handy light and power bank that anyone can use. It makes for an excellent lamp or flashlight, lasting up to 3 hours on bright mode and 6 hours on soft mode. It can also be used as a power bank to charge electronic devices such as cell phones.

 

Charge your cellphone on the go with Solar Milk

column1: Lovely as a living room ornament or a handy little light for the bedroom at night

Light up your campsite

 

The package tells a story: The impacts of Solar Cows are printed like a ray light

 

YOLK has received widespread media coverage and several awards for Solar Cows, including from Time Magazine, an innovation award from the Consumer Electronics Show (CES), and placing in the top three at the Green Tech Awards, all in 2019. In 2018, we also won the aid innovation challenge at AidEx, as well as the iF Social Impact Award. Our grants and partnerships include the P4G Partnership Award, the Korea International Cooperation Agency Creative Technology Solution Program, and a partnership with Energy4Impact.

""I was particularly impressed by the increased attendance and retention rates that the Solar Cow initiative achieved [at a pilot project in Tanzania]
column2: the increase in students' study time
column3:
and the environmentally friendly nature is a feature that could enhance the results of UNESCO's own initiatives.""

 - Tirso Dos Santos, Head of Office and Representative of UNESCO Tanzania

 

 

About YOLK

Technology continues to evolve at a rapid pace. However, there are still many people who are left behind. For example, there are almost 1 billion people without access to electricity, instead using kerosene fuel for light, which causes health complications and increases CO2 emissions. Our team at YOLK began with this single question: What if we could support people in developing countries to establish better lives? The Solar Cow can make the world a brighter place, not only by addressing social and environmental concerns but also by providing warmth and love. 

The founder and CEO of YOLK, Sen Chang, is an award-winning designer who has been recognized through the iF and Red dot design award. After graduating from the Art Institute of Chicago with a bachelor degree in fine arts for designed objects, she founded YOLK in 2015.

Others in the YOLK team include engineering experts with more than 30 years in the energy industry, a professor with extensive knowledge in international development, and a project manager with a decade of experience in developing countries, including the field of solar technology. Our team also includes local staff with experience in working for various NGOs on the ground. We also have marketing experts to help us tell the story of Solar Cow to the world.

YOLK previously raised over $1M on Kickstarter for Solar Paper, the world’s thinnest and lightest solar charger, with 6,000 backers. Solar Paper was featured in over 300 media outlets, and won the 2017 CES Innovation Award.

","How does it work? The Solar Cow – one of Time Magazine’s 100 Best Inventions of 2019 – is a solar charging system installed in schools in rural off-grid regions of Africa. Solar Cow allows children to charge portable batteries, called Solar Milk, while they attend class and take them home at the end of the school day. It becomes a valuable source of energy for charging cell phones and lighting their home at night.Many low-income families rely on kerosene lighting and relatively expensive charging stations to meet their energy needs. The electricity budget of the average Kenyan household takes up to 15% of their monthly income, so saving money on electricity is a great benefit. The green energy from Solar Cow is a tangible incentive for parents to send their children to school instead of work. Meeting the families’ short-term energy needs also helps them break the cycle of poverty on the long run by providing education to children, creating fundamental changes in their lives. Education enables people to improve their own lives without having to rely on external assistance.  YOLK developed a custom charging socket that is only compatible with the Solar Cow charging systems so that parents must send kids to school in order to charge their batteries. This also helps to prevent misallocation or theft. For our Indiegogo backers, we will send Solar Milks that can be charged through a regular USB-C so you can use it at home.Our projects in Kenya and Tanzania proved so effective in increasing attendance rates, it was almost as though the children were brought to school by magic! What’s more, backers who select the Give + Data option can access the attendance data of the child who received a Solar Milk from them. Each battery given to the children in Africa has a unique ID code, which the Solar Cow records every time it is being charged. This allows supporters to see the real impact of their purchase for a better world.With the funding from Indiegogo, we will be able to launch this very new project concept to track the impact of Solar Milks and Solar Cows. Delivering real individual data of users in Africa directly to our backers is something that no other project has tried before. Solar Milk is a handy light and power bank that anyone can use. It makes for an excellent lamp or flashlight, lasting up to 3 hours on bright mode and 6 hours on soft mode. It can also be used as a power bank to charge electronic devices such as cell phones. Charge your cellphone on the go with Solar Milk

column1: Lovely as a living room ornament or a handy little light for the bedroom at night

Light up your campsite The package tells a story: The impacts of Solar Cows are printed like a ray light YOLK has received widespread media coverage and several awards for Solar Cows, including from Time Magazine, an innovation award from the Consumer Electronics Show (CES), and placing in the top three at the Green Tech Awards, all in 2019. In 2018, we also won the aid innovation challenge at AidEx, as well as the iF Social Impact Award. Our grants and partnerships include the P4G Partnership Award, the Korea International Cooperation Agency Creative Technology Solution Program, and a partnership with Energy4Impact.""I was particularly impressed by the increased attendance and retention rates that the Solar Cow initiative achieved [at a pilot project in Tanzania]
column2: the increase in students' study time
column3: and the environmentally friendly nature is a feature that could enhance the results of UNESCO's own initiatives."" - Tirso Dos Santos, Head of Office and Representative of UNESCO Tanzania  About YOLKTechnology continues to evolve at a rapid pace. However, there are still many people who are left behind. For example, there are almost 1 billion people without access to electricity, instead using kerosene fuel for light, which causes health complications and increases CO2 emissions. Our team at YOLK began with this single question: What if we could support people in developing countries to establish better lives? The Solar Cow can make the world a brighter place, not only by addressing social and environmental concerns but also by providing warmth and love. The founder and CEO of YOLK, Sen Chang, is an award-winning designer who has been recognized through the iF and Red dot design award. After graduating from the Art Institute of Chicago with a bachelor degree in fine arts for designed objects, she founded YOLK in 2015.Others in the YOLK team include engineering experts with more than 30 years in the energy industry, a professor with extensive knowledge in international development, and a project manager with a decade of experience in developing countries, including the field of solar technology. Our team also includes local staff with experience in working for various NGOs on the ground. We also have marketing experts to help us tell the story of Solar Cow to the world.YOLK previously raised over $1M on Kickstarter for Solar Paper, the world’s thinnest and lightest solar charger, with 6,000 backers. Solar Paper was featured in over 300 media outlets, and won the 2017 CES Innovation Award.",20.0,1,"6 Campaigns

column7:
Backup Power

Vulcan is an eco-friendly energy system for powering your home, small business, or off-grid activities. It is a powerful alternative to permanent installation storage batteries and gasoline generators in a portable and fully recyclable package.

Vulcan fits your lifestyle to store energy to power your electrical needs 24/7 for days or weeks on a single charge - whether you’re in a house, condo, apartment, RV, or live off-grid.

We invite you to back us to help manufacture the Vulcan, create more American jobs, and create carbon-free and recyclable energy systems for U.S. and international consumers, businesses, and governments. Exclusive to our INDIEGOGO backers, we are offering a 10-year limited warranty!

Reliable grid power is not guaranteed — Our nation’s electricity grid is prone to aging equipment, capacity bottlenecks, and increased demand, as well as storm and climate impacts. Americans will likely experience longer and more frequent power interruptions from events such as wildfires and storms like the ones that caused the California and Texas blackouts. Gain 24/7 energy security and independence with the Vulcan high power and high energy storage system to keep the lights on at all times.
column8:
>

Much more than a battery — Using top-of-the-line inverter, solar charger, power control, AC/DC charger, and battery technologies — Vulcan is an unparalleled electric power source for all your AC loads while at home, working, traveling, or living off-grid.

Two ways of charging — A 4KWH or 5KWH Vulcan system can be recharged with 1200W of solar, 720W of AC, or both simultaneously for up to 1920W combined. Adding more units increases the amount of solar and AC inputs available to keep charging times low and constant.
 

Safe &
column9:
easy battery backup power — Provide a continuous supply of clean power to protect your home, business, hospital, or school if the main power goes out. No need for gas generators that produce dangerous emissions and require regular maintenance. Not all power coming from the grid is safe for you to use. When the grid is overloaded and brownouts occur, voltage drops can ruin your computer and other electronic devices. Our built-in AC filters clean the 120V AC output and allow you to operate sensitive electronics under any power conditions and even works in line with gasoline generators as a multi-source energy system.

Home utility cost reduction — Depending on your utility rate structure, peak demand charges can represent a significant portion of home utility bills. The Vulcan can be used to automatically power critical home loads during peak hours to lower the cost of your electric bill.
 

Efficient home solar storage — If you are considering installing solar panels, pair them with the Vulcan and plug them directly into Vulcan’s native solar panel connectors. If you already have solar panels installed, Vulcan can be AC coupled to store excess energy generated by solar panels for later use or when more electricity is needed (evenings and cloudy days). Use a generator transfer switch with our built-in 30A automatic transfer switch (ATS) to wire Vulcan into your house breaker panel or subpanel. This will automatically keep critical circuits operating during blackouts without manual intervention.
column10:
> 

Working, traveling, or living remotely off-grid — The Vulcan is dust, moisture, weather, and corrosion resistant to operate under harsh conditions across a wide temperature range (-4F to +122F). Our easy plug-and-play system allows you to power anything that you normally power with a 120V AC outlet while you are on the go and provides many convenient ways to quickly recharge using AC and Solar Panel inputs. Our Faraday shielding protects against radio frequency (RF) interference and electromagnetic pulses (EMP), making this also an ideal solution for shelters and bunkers and for operating sensitive radio equipment.

 

Power to run your home - Multiple system configurations can be created to run your appliances and critical electrical needs for days or weeks. Tie another Vulcan into a base 5KWH system and get 6.4KWH of battery storage along with higher charging capacity and 4KW of continuous 120V AC to power more appliances and for longer.
 

Vulcan propels the adoption of solar &
column11:
renewable energy sources, a must for reversing climate change. Vulcan’s modular and expandable design will give you carbon-free, quiet backup power without the need for a gas generator. If you already have a gas generator, our Vulcan system easily integrates with your existing generator, allowing you to limit the noise, reduce fuel consumption, reduce carbon emissions and minimize wear and tear on your generator.

Daisy chain units for more power — Whatever 120V AC appliances you need to power, you can rely on the Vulcan system to meet your needs. Our power cable sets allow for easy expansion within seconds.

Efficiency matters — Not all inverters work alike or are created equally. Having a big battery is of little benefit if the inverter that converts the battery energy to 120V AC operates at low efficiency. Vulcan inverters are industrial grade and operate at 91.5% efficiency. Lower-cost energy generators operate at 80% - 85% efficiency or lower. With a 5KWH battery system, Vulcan provides 4.575KWH vs. 4.25KWH for 85% inverters and 4KWH for 80% inverters. Higher efficiency equals hours or days more power when you need it most.
column12: >How Does Vulcan Compare to Permanent Installation Systems?
column15: >
column17: />
column20:
>

 

Unlike the myriad of other portable energy product providers who are resellers/drop shippers, our Sol Donum team members are the actual Vulcan designers and manufacturers and are here in the States. Those competing products are not realistic for long durations off-grid, they’re not scalable and cannot handle even a single typical 300W+ roof solar panel. With DoD-level engineering, industrial-strength components, and the ability to scale to meet the power requirements of homes and businesses, the Vulcan is built for real-life outages and power needs. 

Unlike typical portable energy systems that may need replacement after a year or two, the Vulcan system is built to last. Our battery technology is designed for daily charge and discharge, and it is tested to perform reliably for over 5000 cycles of complete discharging and recharging, retaining 80% of its capacity after 10 years. We provide customers with trade-in rebates so Sol Donum can refurbish, upgrade or recycle the units as technology evolves.
column22:
>Safety Embedded in Every Layer of Our Energy Systems

We see safety as a foundational element of our corporate responsibility — rooted in our heritage of careers within the U.S. Federal Government, U.S. Department of Defense (DoD), and U.S. Intelligence Communities. Safety is all-pervasive in our company culture and the partnerships we build with our customers, from system design to construction and operations.

We partner with leading technology suppliers who adhere to industry standards, such as IEC, UL, CSA, RoHS, and CE, for all hardware components, semiconductors, connectors, wiring, and subsystems. We use Lithium Iron Phosphate (LiFePO4), which is among the safest, longest-lasting, and highest energy density battery technologies in the world. This is the same battery chemistry used by the oxygen generator for the new Mars rover, Perseverance, and its companion drone. LiFePO4 has excellent thermal and chemical stability so the batteries stay cool in higher temperatures. They are also incombustible, even if mishandled or when there are short circuit issues. LiFePO4 batteries will not overheat, burn or explode during overcharging. They are also non-toxic, do not contain cobalt, and are easily recycled.
column24:
testing — Our products have been in continuous use and testing for 5000+ hours of runtime, without issue or incident. 

Risks &
column25:
mitigations — Due to the recent pandemic affecting Asia and the U.S. there is some uncertainty in the stability of the global supply chain. Over 70% of our product parts are North American made, mitigating the risk, and we will take every effort to continue producing and delivering this product on time. For early backers who support us on IGG, you will receive our earnest gratitude and thoughtful post-sales service. 

 

Sol Donum (Latin for ‘Sun Gift’) came about when one of our co-founders purchased a solar generator to provide power for his home during outages. It did not meet his expectations and the alternative was to purchase an expensive permanent solution wired into his home and tied to the grid. Consequently, he was inspired to research, design, and build a portable, modular, and turnkey system, the Vulcan, to fill the gap between permanent batteries, DIY solutions, and gasoline generators.

We are former Federal Government, DoD, and private-sector engineers, and business professionals who built technology to help protect our troops and our country. We founded, grew, and sold successful software IT companies in commercial and government sectors, and now we’ve focused on developing a next-generation, renewables technology company. From our headquarters in Virginia, we are creating clean energy jobs, and we are manufacturing the energy systems to serve a growing need in the market.

We are passionate about developing products that open the doors to battery storage for more people, help reduce fossil fuel dependency and support energy resilience — one user, one home, one business, and one village at a time. Our portable and price-accessible products provide backup and off-grid power availability for a wider market. Through consumer education, influencing government policy, and offering affordable industrial-grade energy storage — we are increasing the adoption of renewable alternatives for energy generation and backup.
column26: >Clift Briscoe — Chief Products Engineer
column27:
>

Clift has designed, developed, and implemented software and hardware systems within the U.S. Department of Defense and Intelligence Communities. He is an electrical engineer who co-founded several successful IT companies, and he has led the development of power supply and power management technology for computing platforms that must operate in varying environments. He also owns a lot of road racing bicycles - a lot.
column28: >Larry Chang - Chief Operating Officer
column29:
>

Larry started, grew, and sold government services and technology development companies serving the commercial industry and the US Department of Defense. He earned an MBA from George Mason University and Aerospace Engineering degree from Virginia Tech, and he ran startup and mid-size companies as CEO and COO. Before heading up Sol Donum operations, he also consulted for healthcare companies undertaking significant technology development initiatives. He also jams on the violin and has played with numerous musicians ranging from Ray Charles to the Moody Blues to Tony Bennett.
column30: >Sean Curry — Chief Marketing Officer
column31:
>

Throughout his career, Sean has led software development, hardware engineering, professional services, and sales teams for companies serving the U.S. Federal Government, Department of Defense, and Intelligence Communities. He is a graduate of the U.S. Naval Academy and has directed the construction, operation, and maintenance of nuclear and electrical systems on submarines. He also enjoys hiking and baking sourdough bread.
column32: >Cecilia Hansen - Product Marketing Manager
column33:
>

Cecilia’s expertise lies in bringing beautiful and effective software products to a variety of different user groups, including federal government agencies and individual consumers in the commercial space. She is passionate about enabling others to become happier and healthier versions of themselves, which includes driving forward environmental sustainability and clean energy. She earned a B.S. in Integrated Science and Technology from James Madison University and has since relocated to Denver, Colorado to take advantage of the plentiful outdoor activities. Her newest goal is to one day teach her puppy how to paddleboard!
column34: >Lewis W. Hopkins - Sales Executive
column35:
>

Lewis brings an extensive background in industrial design and sales. He has contributed to the design and development of specialized machinery and worked with product manufacturers to streamline production flows and manufacturing processes.  Following his engineering career, he founded a business and real estate brokerage company still in operation. Lewis enjoys camping, horseback riding, and other outdoor activities. He is a graduate of George Mason University.
column36: >Ed Willhide — Software Development Manager
column37:
>

Ed is a seasoned executive and a technology expert in software product applications development. He served as the CTO for a software company whose products were deployed to Fortune 100 companies in support of large-scale IT and security operations, and he then headed product development as the Vice President of a cybersecurity company serving numerous Fortune 500 companies. Ed employs his extensive experience to help shape and deliver software and cloud-based services for the Sol Donum product line. Ed takes every opportunity to go on adventures with his family.

",,21.0,0,"1 Campaign

I, Karen Pare' (Bressner),  am the inventor of the Modular Wind Turbine System (MWTS) which I have been working on for over 15 years. I have two patents and one pending.  In this time, I have completed many studies on this system through a Computer Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and wind tunnel tests at RPI which have all come back positive.

Currently, I am a director of a new company called  WSP Wind Energy, that was formed in April of 2020 with a major investor committed to investing $1 million to complete the Beta 2 unit. Beta 2 is scheduled to begin construction in 2021 at a NREL/Government sponsored test site in Utah. Engineering is complete on the components and quotes are coming in, but the delays this past year due to COVID-19 and major price increases have put a strain on the operating budget, and funds for daily operations will fall short before construction.

Since, I've invested all my available funds into the development of the technology, I am reaching out to my family, friends, and the public for help in raising funds.  I know it’s a lot to ask but every little bit helps.  We currently, have submitted for grants as well, but most have a long waiting period..  A minimum of $300,000 would help the shortfall, but $500,000 would provide a safety net. Anyone interested in becoming a major shareholder can email me directly.

This Beta 2 will be a full 3 layer system and upon completion and operation, it will be able to become certified, allowing us to go to market. Our system is consistent with the current market price for small wind turbines, and we are already reserving units for 2022 with an estimate of $5.5 million in sales.
This system is not like any wind turbine currently on the market and has the potential of changing the industry. Please consider contributing to help reduce our carbon footprint.

The modular wind turbine system can be customized without changing fabrication techniques. This allows the system to enter the end-user location where medium and large conventional turbine towers cannot gain access. Think of manufacturers and businesses having a means to reduce their carbon footprint.
This system uses the Bernoulli Principle to accelerate and groom the wind, the energy output is cubed, which also allows us to produce more energy in less square footage than a conventional system.
Two equations are vital in understanding and constructing wind turbine generators:
(1) The power output of a wind generator is proportional to the area swept by the rotor - double the sweep area and the power output will also double. (Formula for prop-on-pole)

(2) The power output of a wind generator is proportional to the cube of the wind speed - double the wind speed and the power output will increase by a factor of eight (2 x 2 x 2). By accelerating the wind speed we cube our energy output, which allows us to produce more energy in less square footage than a conventional system. This is how the MWTS works.

Our biggest risk is not funding our operational budget in time for construction. Our team is working every avenue to raise funds but with many new innovations and startups, it's tough.  Once the unit is up and sales are contracted, financing is available.  We are fully insured.
If five dollars is too much please send this to as many friends and family that you know that could possibly help.
